hook: Announced a major e-commerce pivot in Nov 2025, shuttering three massive automated fulfillment centers (Wisconsin, Maryland, Florida) to shift focus toward store-based fulfillment in 2026.
overview: The Kroger Co. is the largest pure-play grocery retailer in the United States, operating approximately 2,700 stores across 35 states under nearly two dozen banners.
company_bullets: ["Operates a primary fleet of 2,700 tractors and over 10,000 trailers, ranking as the 4th largest grocery private fleet (Transport Topics/FreightWaves)", "Managing a significant contraction of its high-tech Ocado fulfillment network, paying $350M in Jan 2026 to cancel future projects in North Carolina and Arizona (The Charlotte Observer, Jan 2026)", "Logistics infrastructure includes 38 food production plants and a distribution network serving 2,700+ retail locations (Kroger Fact Book)"]

overview: H-E-B is a dominant regional grocery retailer in Texas and Mexico, known for its vertically integrated supply chain, in-house manufacturing, and high-frequency replenishment model.
company_bullets: ["Operates a high-frequency replenishment model where most stores receive deliveries 3 to 5 times per week from centralized DCs (Logistics Navigators, May 2024)", "Recently introduced the C3 Hive system at Retail Support Center campuses to streamline driver communication and check-in (H-E-B Supplier Portal, Dec 2025)", "Developing a massive multi-phase distribution campus on 500 acres in Hempstead, TX to support rapid expansion in the Houston and DFW markets (Grocery Dive, April 2024)"]

hook: Investing nearly $800 million in fiscal 2025 to expand and modernize its distribution network to support global store growth (TJX Q3 FY25 Earnings Call)
overview: TJX Companies is a leading global off-price apparel and home fashions retailer, operating major brands including T.J. Maxx, Marshalls, HomeGoods, Sierra, and Homesense.
company_bullets: ["Operates a massive global logistics network with 23 distribution centers in the United States and 7 internationally (TJX 2024 Form 10-K)", "Recently completed a 1.5 million square foot distribution center expansion in Lordstown, Ohio to support HomeGoods growth (Business Journal Daily, 2024)", "Relies heavily on third-party contract carriers for the movement of goods from DCs to over 5,000 retail locations (TJX Corporate Responsibility Report 2024)", "Reported $1.8 billion in capital expenditures for FY2025, with a significant portion allocated to distribution capacity and technology (TJX Investor Relations, Nov 2024)"]

hook: Celebrated the grand opening of its new global headquarters in Charlotte, NC, following a strategic relocation from Chicago (Sept 2024).
overview: TTX Company is a leading provider of railcar pooling and freight car management services, operating a massive fleet of over 175,000 railcars for North America's major railroads.
company_bullets: ["Maintains a network of 30+ Field Maintenance Operations (FMOs) and heavy repair facilities across North America to service its 175,000+ railcar fleet (company website)", "Relocated its corporate headquarters to a new $13.8M facility in Charlotte's South End to leverage local logistics talent and the international airport hub (Business North Carolina, Sept 2024)", "Operates under pooling authority granted by the Surface Transportation Board, serving as the primary equipment provider for all major Class I railroads (Wikipedia)"]

hook: Announced a $2 billion North American expansion (May 2025) which includes a new automated distribution center in Beech Island, SC, and a proposed $160 million DC in Warren, OH (Oct 2025).
overview: Kimberly-Clark is a leading global manufacturer of personal care and hygiene products, producing well-known brands such as Huggies, Kleenex, and Scott.
company_bullets: ["Operates 28 owned and leased facilities in North America and 54 globally as part of its manufacturing and distribution network (CRE Daily, May 2025)", "Investing $200 million to add a 1.1 million sq. ft. automated distribution center at its Beech Island, SC factory to increase direct-shipping capabilities (PR Newswire, May 2025)", "Proposed a $160 million, 500,000 sq. ft. regional distribution center in Warren, OH, with potential ground-breaking in Q1 2026 (Business Journal Daily, Oct 2025)"]

job_title: Vice President, Supply Chain Planning and Logistics

hook: Implemented autonomous guided vehicles (AGVs) and 20 automated forklifts at the Nichols, NY distribution center to optimize inbound pallet handling (Dec 2024).
overview: Best Buy Co., Inc. is a leading multinational retailer specializing in consumer electronics, appliances, and technology services through an omnichannel platform of physical stores and e-commerce.
company_bullets: ["Opened its 20th dedicated delivery distribution center (DDC) in Lancaster, Texas, to support large-product fulfillment (Retail Dive, Dec 2024)", "Shifting strategy to reduce ship-from-store volume by leveraging centralized distribution centers for improved inventory holding and e-commerce efficiency (Supply Chain Dive, Sept 2025)", "Operates a network including 7 primary regional distribution centers (RDCs) and approximately 20 DDCs for specialized appliance and television delivery (Company SEC Filing, 2024)"]

hook: Announced the opening of a new operational facility in Ruther Glen, Virginia, to expand regional dedicated services (klbsons.com, 2024/2025).
overview: K.L. Breeden & Sons (KLB) is a specialized transportation carrier providing dedicated fleet services, primarily for the food and retail industries, including major clients like Tyson Foods.
company_bullets: ["Operates a fleet of 676 power units and 613 drivers as of January 2025 (FMCSA SAFER).", "Manages at least 27 distinct operational locations/terminals across the US, including major hubs in Denver, PA, West Jefferson, OH, and Irving, TX (lease2klb.com).", "Specializes in the 'Dedicated Model' for high-volume retail and food distribution, allowing them to handle significant surges without adding additional power units (klbsons.com)."]

hook: Announced a $2.2 billion investment for 2025, which includes the opening of a 1.2 million sq. ft. fully automated distribution center in East Gwillimbury, Ontario (Feb 19, 2025).
overview: Loblaw Companies Limited is Canada's largest food and pharmacy retailer, operating a vast network of grocery, drug, and specialty stores under numerous banners including Loblaws, Shoppers Drug Mart, and No Frills.
company_bullets: ["Operates a primary network of approximately 27 distribution centers across Canada to support over 2,500 retail locations (Loblaw 2024 CSR Report).", "Expanding partnership with Gatik AI to deploy 50 autonomous delivery trucks in the Greater Toronto Area by 2026 to service 300+ stores (Retail Insider, Sept 2025).", "Developing one of North America's largest fully automated distribution facilities in East Gwillimbury to modernize its high-volume supply chain (Loblaw Press Release, Feb 2025)."]

hook: Newell Brands is currently executing a 'Network Optimization' strategy as part of their 2024-2025 'Project Phoenix' to consolidate and modernize their distribution footprint.
overview: Newell Brands is a global consumer goods company with a portfolio of well-known brands including Rubbermaid, Sharpie, Graco, Coleman, and Yankee Candle.
company_bullets: ["Operates 27 primary distribution centers globally with significant concentrations in Ohio, California, and Georgia (2024 10-K Filing)", "Ongoing consolidation of distribution centers is part of a plan to reduce overhead and improve supply chain agility (Newell Brands Investor Update, May 2024)", "Recently automated several high-volume facilities, including a 1.5 million-square-foot distribution hub in Gaston County, NC (Business Wire, 2023)"]

hook: Opening a new strategic Parts & Service center in the Atlanta metro area (Sept 2025) and aggressively expanding the 'Trailers as a Service' (TaaS) fleet to 4,000 units by the end of 2025.
overview: Wabash (formerly Wabash National) is a leading American industrial manufacturer that designs and produces semi-trailers, truck bodies, and liquid transportation systems for the North American logistics and distribution markets.
company_bullets: ["Operates a diverse footprint of 12 primary manufacturing locations across the U.S. and Mexico, including a 2M sq. ft. flagship facility in Lafayette, IN (Manufacturing Today, 2024)", "Recently announced the idling of facilities in Little Falls, MN and Goshen, IN as part of a corporate reorganization to be completed by Q2 2026 (Investing.com, Jan 2026)", "Aggressively expanding its 'Preferred Partner Network' for parts distribution, recently adding 14 new locations across seven states including MN, WI, and TX (Company Press Release, Nov 2024)"]

hook: Opened a new 175-employee automated micro-fulfillment center in Brooklyn Park, Minnesota to service 200 Midwest stores (May 2025)
overview: Walgreens is a leading integrated healthcare, pharmacy, and retail company that operates a vast network of drugstores across the United States.
company_bullets: ["Operates a private fleet of over 1,000 tractors, ranking among the top five wholesale/retail private carriers in the U.S. (Transport Topics, Aug 2023)", "Expanded its automated logistics network to 12 micro-fulfillment centers as of May 2025, which now handle roughly 40% of prescription volume for 5,000+ stores (Walgreens Press Release, May 2025)", "Utilizes a centralized logistics model with 15 primary distribution centers across the U.S. to manage high-velocity retail and pharmacy inventory (Walgreens Careers/SupplierNet)"]

Southwest regional hub in Arizona by spring 2026, which will be one of its largest facilities (Company Press Release, Oct 2025)", "Recently broke ground on a new 1.1M sq. ft. distribution center in Marietta, OK, expected to be fully operational by spring 2027 to replace a facility destroyed by a 2024 tornado (Supply Chain Dive, Oct 2025)"]

hook: Expanded global capabilities through the strategic synergy with Morrison Express, announced in February 2025, to strengthen high-tech and semiconductor logistics.
overview: EFL Global is a leading supply chain and logistics provider specializing in freight forwarding, warehousing, and 3PL solutions across fashion, technology, and pharmaceuticals.
company_bullets: ["Operates a diverse 3PL infrastructure including 175,000 sq. ft. in Mumbai and a dedicated 53,000 sq. ft. e-commerce facility in Bengaluru (ET Edge Insights, Oct 2025)", "Acquired Morrison Express in February 2025 to combine air freight and high-tech expertise with EFL's existing ocean and apparel strengths (Air Cargo Week, Jan 2026)", "Maintains 70+ owned offices across 39 countries, including a significant facility network in Central America with 11+ locations in Guatemala alone (company website, Jan 2026)"]

hook: Kenvue announced in May 2024 the establishment of its new global headquarters in Summit, New Jersey, which includes a newly renovated 290,000-square-foot office building and plans for a new R&D center.
overview: Kenvue is the world's largest pure-play consumer health company by revenue, formerly the Consumer Healthcare division of Johnson & Johnson, managing iconic brands like Tylenol, Neutrogena, and Band-Aid.
company_bullets: ["Operates a global supply chain network consisting of approximately 25 manufacturing facilities and a significant number of distribution centers primarily managed through third-party logistics (Kenvue 2023 10-K)", "Completed its full separation from Johnson & Johnson in August 2023, necessitating the independent build-out of its own dedicated logistics and IT infrastructure (Kenvue Investor Relations, Aug 2023)", "The company manages a complex distribution network to service over 165 countries, prioritizing the modernization of its supply chain to improve agility and resilience (Kenvue ESG Report 2023)"]
job_title: Senior Manager Transportation Technology and Services

hook: Issued a request for proposal for the pre-development of Pier 500 (Jan 2026), a new 200-acre container terminal that will prioritize automated yard blocks and 'rail-first' gate strategies.
overview: The Port of Los Angeles is the busiest container port in North America, serving as a primary gateway for international trade managed by the Los Angeles Harbor Department.
company_bullets: ["Operates 25 cargo terminals including 7 major container terminals across 7,500 acres (portoflosangeles.org)", "Opened new I-110 and SR 47 interchange ramps in Jan 2026 as part of a major infrastructure phase near the Vincent Thomas Bridge (portoflosangeles.org, Jan 2026)", "Manages Foreign-Trade Zone 202, which includes over 35 general-purpose warehouse sites across Southern California (portoflosangeles.org)"]

hook: Announced plans to establish a new multi-use facility in Kingman, Arizona, to bring parts and service operations closer to U.S. customers (Jan 2026)
overview: Crown Equipment Corporation is one of the world's largest material handling companies, specializing in the design, manufacture, and distribution of a wide range of electric and internal combustion lift trucks and automation technologies.
company_bullets: ["Operates a global network of 24 manufacturing facilities across 14 locations and over 500 retail locations worldwide (company website)", "Registered as a private carrier/shipper with the USDOT, operating a fleet of 357 power units and 359 drivers (FMCSA SAFER, Jan 2026)", "Recently expanded manufacturing capacity with a $13 million investment in Kinston, North Carolina, expected to create 130+ jobs (North Carolina Governor's Office, Dec 2024)"]

hook: Announced a $52M investment in a new five-story office expansion at their Marchtrenk headquarters to support their goal of doubling revenue to $2B by 2030 (Nov 2025).
overview: TGW Logistics Group is a global systems integrator and manufacturer of automated warehouse solutions, specializing in the design, implementation, and maintenance of high-performance fulfillment centers.
company_bullets: ["Operates 24 global units across Europe, North America, and Asia providing systems integration for complex logistics centers (tgw-group.com)", "Investing approximately $109M (100M EUR) in a 172,000 sq ft production hall and automated storage system expansion at its Austrian headquarters scheduled for 2026 completion (company press release, Oct 2024)", "Recently achieved a record order intake of $1.58B (1.5B EUR) for the 2024/25 fiscal year, representing a 55% increase (tgw-group.com, Oct 2025)"]

hook: Announced a major Midwest expansion into six new cities including Indianapolis, St. Louis, and Columbus, with operations set to go live April 1, 2025 (Supply Chain Dive, March 2025).
overview: Jitsu is a technology-driven last-mile delivery carrier that provides same-day and next-day parcel delivery services for e-commerce brands by utilizing an asset-light, gig-economy driver model and a network of urban sortation centers.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of urban sortation centers across 23 major U.S. metro areas as of mid-2024 (supplychain247.com, June 2024)", "Launched a new regional hub in Indianapolis and a sortation center in Highland Park, Michigan, to support Midwest delivery volumes (Supply Chain Dive, March 2025)", "Utilizes an asset-light logistics model where proprietary AI tech manages a fleet of gig drivers and Delivery Service Partners rather than company-owned tractors (Bee Partners VC, 2024)"]

hook: Announced a $475M strategic investment from Blackstone Credit & Insurance to fund a new 1M+ sq. ft. highly automated distribution center in Burlington, N.C. (Jan 13, 2026)
overview: ADUSA Distribution & Transportation is the supply chain arm of Ahold Delhaize USA, managing one of the largest private fleets and distribution networks on the East Coast to support grocery brands like Food Lion, Giant Food, and Stop & Shop.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 22 distribution centers following a multi-year transition to a self-managed supply chain model (Supermarket News, May 2024)", "Constructing a new $860M highly automated facility in Burlington, NC, expected to open by 2029 with 1M+ sq. ft. of fresh and frozen capacity (Ahold Delhaize Press Release, Oct 2025)", "Manages logistics and last-mile delivery for approximately 2,000 grocery retail locations including Food Lion, Hannaford, and Giant Food (Ahold Delhaize USA, Dec 2022)"]

hook: CN announced a partnership with the Port of New Orleans and the state of Louisiana in December 2025 to enhance intermodal terminal security and efficiency at the new Louisiana International Terminal.
overview: Canadian National Railway (CN) is a leading North American transportation and logistics company, operating a 19,500-mile rail network that connects the Atlantic, Pacific, and Gulf coasts.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 22 strategically located 'Logistics Parks' and 'CargoFlow' distribution facilities across Canada and the U.S. (CN 2024 Investor Fact Book)", "The CNTL division is one of Canada\u2019s largest door-to-door trucking fleets with over 1,100 owner-operators and company tractors (CN TL Operations Overview)", "Committed $3.5 billion in 2024 to capital expenditures, focusing significantly on network technology, yard automation, and capacity improvements (CN Press Release, Jan 2024)"]

hook: Announced a major strategic consolidation into two primary divisions, Shipping/Logistics and Energy, to accelerate operational scale and customer value (Jan 2026).

hook: PACCAR Parts expanded its global network to 20 Distribution Centers in late 2024 with new openings in Germany and Colombia, while Dynacraft continues to leverage its 184,000 sq ft McKinney, TX headquarters opened in 2019 (PACCAR Annual Report, Feb 2025).
overview: Dynacraft, a division of PACCAR, is a high-volume manufacturer and distributor of complex commercial vehicle components for Peterbilt, Kenworth, and DAF truck brands.
company_bullets: ["Operates primary manufacturing and distribution facilities in McKinney, TX (184,000 sq ft on 82 acres) and Louisville, KY (41 acres) (dynacraftnet.com)", "Leverages PACCAR Parts' global network of 20 distribution centers and 3.9 million sq ft of warehouse space to support 2,700 commercial fleets (PACCAR 2024 Annual Report, Feb 2025)", "Maintains a long-standing partnership with Crossgate Logistics for a 500,000 sq ft fulfillment operation in Port Wentworth, GA (crossgatelogistics.com)"]

hook: Grifols recently received FDA approval for FESILTY, a new fibrinogen concentrate, with a U.S. market launch scheduled for early 2026 (Company Press Release, Dec 2025).
overview: Grifols is a global healthcare leader specializing in plasma-derived medicines, diagnostic systems, and hospital pharmacy solutions, serving patients in more than 110 countries.
company_bullets: ["Operates a global industrial network of 15 manufacturing facilities and 6 specialized testing laboratories across 7 countries (company website)", "Manages one of the world's largest plasma collection networks with approximately 400 donation centers across North America, Europe, and the Middle East (Wikipedia/Company Data)", "Maintains a flagship production and logistics hub in Clayton, NC, which serves as one of the world's largest plasma fractionation sites (company website)"]

hook: Exceeded its 2025 sustainability goal by achieving over 5.3 million natural gas miles through strategic dedicated partnerships (Jan 2026).

overview: CVS Health is a diversified health solutions company that operates one of the nation's largest retail pharmacy chains, a leading pharmacy benefits manager (CVS Caremark), and a health insurance provider (Aetna).
company_bullets: ["Operates 18 major distribution campuses across the U.S. that support over 9,000 retail locations (TLI Magazine)", "Maintains a private fleet of approximately 300 tractors and 1,500 trailers, supplemented by third-party carriers like Penske and Ryder (TLI Magazine)", "Announced a strategic plan to close 270+ retail stores in 2025 while opening 30 new high-engagement pharmacy locations (NBC Chicago/Company Statement, May 2025)", "Utilizes advanced telematics and data analytics to optimize routing and maneuvering into varied loading dock configurations at its thousands of retail sites (Trucking Info)"]

hook: Lynden Transport recently completed a significant fleet and facility modernization at their Fife, WA hub to enhance cold chain reliability for Alaska-bound freight (Lynden News, October 2024).
overview: Lynden is a multi-modal transportation and logistics provider specializing in complex freight movement, including ocean, air, trucking, and logistics services primarily across the Pacific Northwest, Alaska, and Canada.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 18 dedicated logistics service centers and warehouses across the U.S. and Canada, specializing in high-value and climate-controlled storage (Lynden Logistics website)", "Maintains a diverse fleet of over 800 power units across multiple operating companies including Lynden Transport and LTI, Inc. (FMCSA SAFER data, Jan 2026)", "Ranked as one of the Top 100 For-Hire Carriers in North America, with a focus on specialized equipment for extreme environments (Transport Topics, 2024)"]

hook: Qurate Retail Group recently completed a multi-year project to optimize its fulfillment network, including the 2024 expansion of its cornerstone automated facility in West Chester (Qurate Retail Investor Day, late 2024).
overview: QVC Group, part of Qurate Retail Group, includes Cornerstone Brands which manages interactive lifestyle brands like Frontgate, Ballard Designs, and Garnet Hill, supported by a large-scale logistics network.
company_bullets: ["Operates a combined network of approximately 18 fulfillment and distribution centers across the US under the Qurate/Cornerstone umbrella (Qurate Retail Group 10-K Filing, 2024)", "Cornerstone Brands specifically operates major distribution hubs in Ohio and Arizona to support its home and apparel brands (Cornerstone Brands Corporate Site)", "The company has focused on 'Project Athens' to improve fulfillment speed and reduce logistics costs, emphasizing automation at gate and dock levels (Qurate Financial Press Release, 2024)"]

hook: Expanded operations nationally in March 2025 following a merger of seven companies, reaching a fleet size of over 1,000 tractors (Transport Topics, Mar 2025).
overview: SalSon Logistics is an asset-based third-party logistics (3PL) provider specializing in port-to-shelf supply chain solutions, including drayage, warehousing, and dedicated fleet services.
company_bullets: ["Operates over 3 million square feet of warehouse space across 18 terminal locations at major East, West, and Gulf Coast ports (company website)", "Maintains a flagship 55-acre multi-location campus in Newark, NJ with over 100 acres of secured parking and 1 million sq. ft. of warehouse space (Transport Topics, Mar 2025)", "Actively expanding its intermodal and transloading footprint with a new 260,000 sq. ft. facility in West Compton, CA, featuring 20 acres of secured logistics space (Transport Topics, Mar 2025)"]

hook: Recently opened a 1.5 million-square-foot automated Retail Support Center in Kansas City that is twice the size of their average DC (August 2025).
overview: Ace Hardware Corporation is the world's largest retailer-owned hardware cooperative, providing wholesale distribution of home improvement and building products to over 5,800 locally owned stores globally.
company_bullets: ["Operates a primary network of 17 distribution centers in the U.S. with additional capabilities in China, Panama, and the UAE (company website, 2025)", "Executing a 24-month consolidation plan for its Northeast network, shifting operations to a new DC in Fredericksburg, PA and an expanded facility in Wilton, NY (Industrial Distribution, Dec 2025)", "Reported 17,000 annual Ace fleet shipments and utilizes advanced route optimization and onboard computers to manage approximately 500 dedicated drivers (Fleet Owner / LeanLogistics Case Study)"]

hook: Recently opened two new technologically advanced distribution centers in the U.S. during fiscal 2025 and is nearing completion on additional facilities in Mexico and Brazil (2025 Annual Report).
overview: AutoZone is the leading retailer and distributor of automotive replacement parts and accessories in the Americas, providing DIY and commercial products to over 7,700 stores.
company_bullets: ["Operates a primary supply chain network of 16 distribution centers, including 13 in the U.S., two in Mexico, and one in Brazil (2025 Annual Report)", "Accelerating store growth with a plan to open 325\u2013350 new locations in FY 2026, supported by an expanded 'Mega Hub' infrastructure (Seeking Alpha, Sept 2025)", "Logistics operations rely on a massive fleet of tractors and trailers for store replenishment and approximately 16,000 light-duty vehicles for commercial delivery (Company 10-K, Oct 2025; Automotive Fleet)"]

hook: Basic 3PL is currently marketing its 'Amazon-grade' automation engine and a 10 million square foot network across key hubs like Northern Kentucky and Houston (Jan 2026).
overview: Basic 3PL provides tech-enabled fulfillment and distribution services focused on high-growth U.S. brands, utilizing an automated network infrastructure to handle both small and large-format inventory.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 16+ distribution centers totaling 10 million square feet across the U.S. (basic3pl.com)", "Key strategic hubs include a 3X node facility in Northern Kentucky and double nodes in City of Industry, CA, and Houston, TX (basic3pl.com)", "Leverages 'Soapbox OMS' for real-time visibility and integrates with an 'in-house fleet' specifically for direct last-mile injection rather than long-haul assets (basic3pl.com)"]

hook: Ashley Furniture recently announced the development of a new 500,000-square-foot facility in Jefferson, Wisconsin, specifically to enhance regional distribution capabilities (Milwaukee Business Journal, May 2024).
overview: Ashley Distribution Services is the private fleet and logistics arm of Ashley Furniture Industries, one of the world's largest furniture manufacturers, providing long-haul, regional, and store-delivery services.
company_bullets: ["Operates a massive private fleet of over 1,200 tractors and 4,000 trailers to service 6,000+ retail partners (FMCSA/Company Website)", "Maintains a network of approximately 15 major regional distribution centers across the U.S., including key hubs in Arcadia, WI, Advance, NC, and Redlands, CA (Ashley Furniture Logistics Data)", "The fleet is currently transitioning to more automated driver safety and logistics tracking technologies to optimize their 'Direct-to-Store' delivery model (Transport Topics, 2024)"]

company_bullets: ["Operates a fleet of over 3,000 trucks and 7,000 trailers across North America (MatrixBCG, Sept 2025)", "Maintaining a warehousing segment that generated $24.3M in Q4 revenue with day-to-day management and shuttle services (FreightWaves, Jan 2025)", "Manages a drayage network spanning the U.S. Southeast and South-Central regions with key hubs in Atlanta, Savannah, and Dallas (Company Website, Jan 2026)"]

hook: Dependable Supply Chain Services recently strengthened its regional footprint by expanding its specialized harbor drayage and intermodal operations to support increased volume at the Port of Los Angeles and Long Beach (Company Logistics Update, 2024/2025).
overview: Dependable Supply Chain Services (DHE) is a full-service logistics provider offering LTL and FTL trucking, asset-based warehousing, distribution, and harbor drayage primarily across the Western United States.
company_bullets: ["Operates over 2 million square feet of warehouse space across 14 strategic distribution centers in California and Arizona (company website)", "Maintains an asset-based fleet of 684 power units and 1,760 trailers for LTL, FTL, and harbor drayage operations (FMCSA SAFER data, Jan 2026)", "Operates one of the largest off-dock container freight stations (CFS) in the Los Angeles/Long Beach region, requiring high-volume gate management (company services page)"]

company_name: Hale Trailer Brake and Wheel, Inc
hook: Recent expansion into the Midwest with a new full-service branch opening in North Little Rock, Arkansas, to support regional logistics (Company Press Release, July 2025)
overview: Hale Trailer Brake & Wheel is North America's largest independent trailer dealership, specializing in the sale, rental, and servicing of new and used trailers, as well as specialized hauling equipment and parts.
company_bullets: ["Operates 14 full-service branch locations across the East Coast and Southeast that function as regional distribution hubs for parts and equipment (company website)", "Features a massive rental fleet of over 18,000 trailers, requiring significant yard management and secure storage solutions at their branches (LinkedIn company profile)", "Recently expanded their footprint by acquiring a new facility in Portland, Maine, to increase their service and parts distribution capacity (Press Release, January 2024)"]

hook: Launched a $1 billion self-funded reinvestment plan in late 2023 to modernize supply chain technology and enhance fulfillment capabilities through 2025.
overview: JCPenney is a leading American midscale department store chain that operates across the United States and Puerto Rico, specializing in apparel, home furnishings, and beauty products.
company_bullets: ["Operates 11 regional distribution centers and 3 specialized furniture distribution centers across the U.S. (JCPenney Supply Chain Overview)", "Invested in a massive 1.1 million-square-foot facility in Reno, NV to serve as a primary West Coast e-commerce fulfillment hub (Reno Gazette Journal, 2023)", "Focusing on 'Store-as-a-Hub' strategy which integrates physical store inventory with DC operations, requiring tighter security at loading docks (JCPenney Investor Update, 2024)"]

hook: Kohl's recently announced a strategic expansion of its partnership with Sephora to include all 1,100+ stores, significantly increasing inventory throughput requirements across its logistics network (Company Press Release, March 2024).
overview: Kohl's, Inc. is a leading omnichannel retailer operating department stores and e-commerce platforms, offering private label and national brand apparel, footwear, and home products.
company_bullets: ["Operates 9 regional distribution centers and 5 dedicated e-commerce fulfillment centers across the United States (2023 Annual Report/10-K)", "Implemented a massive omnichannel pivot, utilizing 1,100+ retail locations as 'mini-hubs' for ship-from-store and buy-online-pickup-in-store services (Supply Chain Dive, 2023)", "Focuses on supply chain modernization through automated sorting and inventory management systems at its 1.2M sq ft San Bernardino fulfillment center (Logistics Management, 2023)"]
job_title: Global Director, Trade Compliance At Kohl's Inc

hook: Unveiled plans for a new 1 million-square-foot distribution facility in the Lansing, Michigan area to enhance regional supply chain efficiency (May 2024).
overview: Meijer is a family-owned regional retailer operating supercenters, grocery stores, and pharmacies across the Midwest, maintaining a highly integrated private logistics network.
company_bullets: ["Operates a sophisticated logistics network centered around regional hubs in Michigan, Ohio, and Wisconsin, including the massive Tipp City and Lansing complexes (Meijer Newsroom)", "Invested significantly in fleet modernization, becoming the first retail fleet in North America to deploy the Freightliner eCascadia electric semi-truck (FreightWaves, Dec 2022)", "Maintains 14 major distribution and manufacturing facilities that handle cold storage, dry goods, and pharmaceutical fulfillment (Meijer Supply Chain Overview)"]

hook: Uline is currently constructing a new 1.2 million-square-foot distribution hub in Plainfield, CT, which is scheduled to be fully operational by November 2026 (Modern Distribution Management, July 2025).
overview: Uline is North America's leading family-owned distributor of shipping, industrial, and packaging materials, providing over 40,000 products to businesses with a focus on same-day shipping and operational excellence.
company_bullets: ["Operates over 28 million square feet of space across 14 branch locations in the U.S., Canada, and Mexico (Urban Milwaukee, April 2025)", "The company recently opened a 1.44 million-square-foot facility in Kenosha County, currently the largest warehouse in Wisconsin (Uline Press Release, Dec 2024)", "The upcoming Connecticut expansion will specifically involve a localized fleet of 80 trucks to serve the New England region (Hartford Courant via MDM, July 2025)"]

hook: Alliance Shippers recently received its 13th consecutive 'Quest for Quality' Award in the Intermodal Solutions category, highlighting their sustained volume and operational excellence (Logistics Management, August 2025).
overview: Alliance Shippers, Inc. is a leading private provider of global logistics services, specializing in premier intermodal transport, over-the-road trucking, and comprehensive temperature-controlled supply chain solutions.
company_bullets: ["Operates a dedicated warehouse division with 13 key distribution facilities across the US and Canada, including major hubs in Chicago, Dallas, and New Jersey (company website)", "Manages a massive fleet of over 2,100 proprietary 53-foot refrigerated trailers, requiring significant secure yard management at rail ramps and facilities (company equipment specs)", "Maintains a network of 62 regional offices across North America, indicating a highly decentralized operational structure for local drayage and logistics (company overview)"]

overview: Crocs, Inc. is a global leader in innovative casual footwear, specializing in proprietary foam-based clogs and sandals under the Crocs and HEYDUDE brands.

hook: Dematic recently announced the launch of its new 1.4-million-square-foot facility in Monterrey, Mexico, to increase production capacity for the Americas (April 2024).

hook: Recent acquisition by 3G Capital (closed 2022) has triggered a multi-year 'operational excellence' initiative focused on streamlining the supply chain and consolidating manufacturing footprints.
overview: Hunter Douglas is a global market leader in custom window treatments and architectural products, manufacturing a wide range of blinds, shades, and shutters for residential and commercial markets.
company_bullets: ["Operates approximately 13 major fabrication and distribution centers in North America including key hubs in Salt Lake City, Tupelo, and Bessemer (Company Fact Sheet)", "Transferred significant distribution and assembly operations to a 344,000-square-foot facility in San Diego to optimize West Coast logistics (San Diego Business Journal)", "Primarily relies on common carriers like FedEx and specialized LTL providers for residential 'last-mile' delivery rather than a private long-haul fleet (Inbound Logistics)"]

hook: Discussed the integration of RFID-embedded 'smart assets' with automated material handling and ASRS systems in a recent supply chain spotlight (Oct 2025)
overview: iGPS Logistics, LLC is a leading North American plastic pallet pooling provider that utilizes embedded RFID technology to offer sustainable, lightweight, and trackable shipping solutions.
company_bullets: ["Operates a primary network of 13 full-service depots supported by over 240 retailer-partner 'iDepots' for pallet accumulation and light sorting (Packaging Revolution, Nov 2022)", "Maintains a specialized fleet of 20 power units and 155 trailers to facilitate empty pallet recovery and distribution (FMCSA SAFER, Jan 2026)", "The company's technology roadmap for 2026 focuses on supply chain resilience and near-100% inventory accuracy through AI-driven robotic inspection systems (Inbound Logistics Video Podcast, Oct 2025)"]

hook: Announced the closure of its San Bernardino E-commerce Fulfillment Center and 27 stores by April 2025 as part of a strategic shift toward store-based fulfillment and operational efficiency (Jan 9, 2025).
overview: Kohl's is a leading omnichannel retailer operating over 1,100 stores across the United States, specializing in apparel, home, and beauty products through its expansive physical footprint and e-commerce platform.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 9 distribution centers and 4 e-fulfillment centers nationwide, following the planned 2025 closures of facilities in San Bernardino, CA and Monroe, OH (kohls.com, June 2025)", "Investing $400M-$425M annually in supply chain enhancements, including a major expansion of its 900,000 sq ft fulfillment center in Plainfield, Indiana (RetailWire, June 2025)", "Focusing on a 'store-based fulfillment' model where 36% of digital demand is fulfilled directly from store inventory to improve local delivery speed (Supply Chain Dive)"]

hook: La-Z-Boy is currently undergoing a massive 'Century Vision' distribution revamp to consolidate 15 regional distribution centers into three centralized mega-hubs and a network of small-format cross-docks (Sept 2025).
overview: La-Z-Boy is a global manufacturer and retailer of residential furniture, operating as one of the world's leading producers of reclining chairs.
company_bullets: ["In August 2025, La-Z-Boy transitioned into its first of three planned centralized hubs in Arizona as part of a multi-year network redesign (Supply Chain Dive, Sept 2025).", "The company operates a private fleet under La-Z-Boy Logistics Inc. with 212 power units and 180 drivers (FMCSA SAFER, Jan 2026).", "Recent acquisitions include a 15-store licensee network and four associated warehouses in the Southeast region, set to close in late 2025 (Furniture Today, July 2025)."]

hook: Showcasing new secure and sustainable end-of-line packaging tapes at PACK EXPO Las Vegas (August 2025).
overview: Shurtape Technologies is a leading manufacturer of pressure-sensitive tapes and consumer home and office products, famous for brands like Duck, FrogTape, and T-Rex.
company_bullets: ["Operates 13 global facilities across the US, UK, Germany, Mexico, Peru, UAE, and China, encompassing manufacturing, distribution, and service (shurtapetech.com)", "Received Safety Awards from the North Carolina Department of Labor for the 15th consecutive year in July 2025 (shurtapetech.com, July 2025)", "Maintains a private fleet registered with the FMCSA consisting of 3 power units and 4 drivers, primarily for adhesive tape transport (FMCSA, August 2025)"]

hook: Acquired by Greenbriar Equity Group in Jan 2026, signaling a major capital injection for scaling their technology and distribution infrastructure.
overview: eShipping is a managed transportation and 3PL provider that offers multi-modal logistics solutions, including LTL, full truckload, international freight, and specialized warehousing services.
company_bullets: ["Operates 13 primary warehouse and distribution facilities across key hubs including Kansas City, Dallas, Chicago, Los Angeles, and Harrisburg (company website)", "Completed a significant acquisition by Greenbriar Equity Group on Jan 6, 2026, to fuel expansion of their managed transportation and fulfillment products (Business Wire, Jan 2026)", "Focuses on 'Distribution Chain Management' for mid-sized shippers, utilizing a proprietary cloud-based TMS (eShipManager) and WMS to manage outsourced carrier networks rather than an owned fleet (company website)"]

hook: Acquired by Greenbriar Equity Group in Jan 2026, signaling a major capital injection for scaling their technology and distribution infrastructure.
overview: eShipping is a managed transportation and 3PL provider that offers multi-modal logistics solutions, including LTL, full truckload, international freight, and specialized warehousing services.
company_bullets: ["Operates 13 primary warehouse and distribution facilities across key hubs including Kansas City, Dallas, Chicago, Los Angeles, and Harrisburg (company website)", "Completed a significant acquisition by Greenbriar Equity Group on Jan 6, 2026, to fuel expansion of their managed transportation and fulfillment products (Business Wire, Jan 2026)", "Focuses on 'Distribution Chain Management' for mid-sized shippers, utilizing a proprietary cloud-based TMS (eShipManager) and WMS to manage outsourced carrier networks rather than an owned fleet (company website)"]

hook: Lululemon recently transitioned to a new 1.2 million-square-foot distribution center in the Greater Los Angeles Area to enhance omni-channel fulfillment capabilities (Company 10-K, March 2024).
overview: lululemon athletica inc. is a multinational designer and retailer of technical athletic apparel, footwear, and accessories, operating a global network of company-owned stores and a robust direct-to-consumer e-commerce platform.
company_bullets: ["Operates 13 primary distribution centers located in the U.S. (7), Canada (2), Australia (1), New Zealand (1), the Netherlands (1), and China (1) (2023 Annual Report)", "Invested heavily in 'Project Athena,' a multi-year supply chain initiative focused on scaling fulfillment technology and distribution capacity (Supply Chain Dive, June 2023)", "The company relies on third-party logistics (3PL) providers for nearly all freight, meaning security conversations should focus on gate access for high-volume carrier traffic rather than owned-fleet parking (2023 Annual Report)"]

hook: Acquired and is currently automating its first major 2 million-square-foot Southeast distribution center in Savannah, GA, scheduled to be fully operational in 2026.
overview: Burlington Stores is a leading national off-price retailer offering a diverse selection of fashion-focused merchandise, including apparel, home goods, and accessories.
company_bullets: ["Operates 6 primary distribution centers totaling over 5.1M sq ft, supported by 5 additional warehousing facilities in NJ and CA (2025 Proxy Statement)", "Executing a 'supply chain modernization' strategy with a $750M CapEx budget for 2024-2025, specifically focused on owning rather than leasing facilities to implement custom gate and flow automation (Supply Chain Dive, Dec 2024)", "Aggressively expanding its retail footprint with 110 new store openings planned for 2026, increasing demand for high-velocity cross-docking and trailer security at regional hubs (Talk Business & Politics, Jan 2026)"]

hook: Acquired a 2 million-square-foot distribution center in Savannah, Georgia, slated to be fully operational and 'highly automated' by 2026 (Supply Chain Dive, April 2025).
overview: Burlington Stores is a major American off-price retailer offering a wide range of apparel, home goods, and accessories through its extensive network of department stores.
company_bullets: ["Operates 6 primary distribution centers and 5 supporting warehousing facilities, totaling 11 key logistics nodes as of early 2025 (SEC 10-K, March 2025)", "Executing a 'long-term supply chain investment strategy' to transition from leasing to owning its most productive facilities, recently purchasing sites in Riverside, CA and Savannah, GA (Supply Chain Dive, April 2025)", "Aggressive expansion plan to open 110 net new stores in 2026, targeting a long-term goal of 2,000 total locations (Nasdaq, Dec 2025)"]

hook: Acquired a 2 million-square-foot distribution center in Savannah, Georgia, slated to be fully operational and 'highly automated' by 2026 (Supply Chain Dive, April 2025).
overview: Burlington Stores is a major American off-price retailer offering a wide range of apparel, home goods, and accessories through its extensive network of department stores.
company_bullets: ["Operates 6 primary distribution centers and 5 supporting warehousing facilities, totaling 11 key logistics nodes as of early 2025 (SEC 10-K, March 2025)", "Executing a 'long-term supply chain investment strategy' to transition from leasing to owning its most productive facilities, recently purchasing sites in Riverside, CA and Savannah, GA (Supply Chain Dive, April 2025)", "Aggressive expansion plan to open 110 net new stores in 2026, targeting a long-term goal of 2,000 total locations (Nasdaq, Dec 2025)"]

hook: Burlington recently exercised a purchase option for a new 2.06 million-square-foot, 'highly automated' distribution center in Ellabell/Savannah, Georgia, expected to be operational in Fiscal 2026 (March 2025).
overview: Burlington Stores, Inc. is a leading American off-price retailer of high-quality, branded apparel, home goods, and accessories, operating over 1,100 stores across 46 states.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 12 primary distribution centers and warehousing facilities, with a strategic shift toward owning rather than leasing to enable custom automation (Supply Chain Dive, Dec 2024)", "Is currently investing $750M in capital expenditures, with 30% earmarked for supply chain upgrades including material-handling equipment and site automation (Retail Dive, April 2024)", "Recently acquired a 'most efficient, most automated' West Coast distribution facility in Riverside, California to support its long-term growth goal of 2,000 stores (Supply Chain Dive, April 2025)"]
job_title: Senior Manager, Inbound Transportation & Supply Chain Claims

hook: Opened a new $80M high-automation ecommerce fulfillment center in North Las Vegas in late 2024/early 2025 to serve as the primary U.S. shipping hub (Aug 2025 Nevada GOED announcement).
overview: Crocs, Inc. is a global leader in innovative casual footwear, specializing in molded foam clogs and sandals through its flagship Crocs and HEYDUDE brands.
company_bullets: ["Operates a global logistics footprint of 2.9 million square feet of company-operated facilities and 900,000 square feet of third-party space (SEC 10-K, Dec 2024).", "Recent logistics centralization moved North American operations to a 550,000 sq ft automated hub in Dayton, Ohio to increase throughput by 50% (JobsOhio, June 2023).", "Confirmed primary distribution hubs are located in the United States (Ohio and Nevada) and the Netherlands, with additional 3PL centers in 10 countries including China and Brazil (2024 Annual Report)."]

hook: Achieved a record 562% year-over-year growth in electric vehicle (EV) deliveries in 2024, completing 1.5 million shipments via its sustainable network (Jan 2025).
overview: GoBolt is a technology-driven 3PL and last-mile logistics provider that builds sustainable supply chain networks, specializing in carbon-neutral fulfillment and delivery services for retail and DTC brands.
company_bullets: ["Operates 12 first-party fulfillment centers across major North American metropolitan hubs including Toronto, Los Angeles, and New York City (company website).", "Managed a 250% revenue growth from 2020 to 2024, ranking No. 13 on Deloitte\u2019s 2025 Technology Fast 50 list for Canada (PR Newswire, Oct 2025).", "Fleet strategy focuses on heavy electrification with a projected 185+ electric vans and trucks supported by nearly 200 proprietary Level 2 chargers (Electric Autonomy, Sept 2022)."]

hook: Achieved a record 562% year-over-year growth in electric vehicle (EV) deliveries in 2024, completing 1.5 million shipments via its sustainable network (Jan 2025).

hook: Announced a massive $3 billion, five-year investment plan in August 2025 to modernize its 11 U.S. manufacturing plants and expand its nationwide distribution network.
overview: Haier US Appliance Solutions, operating as GE Appliances, is a major manufacturer and distributor of household appliances across North America with its primary headquarters at the 750-acre Appliance Park in Louisville, KY.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 11 major U.S. distribution centers and one specialized logistics center to support its manufacturing and retail supply chain (GE Appliances Corporate Sandbox, 2025).", "Invested $150 million to open new Area Distribution Centers in strategic hubs including Denver, Dallas, Northern Georgia, and Northern California (Wikipedia/GE Appliances Press, 2023).", "The flagship Denver Area Distribution Center serves as a blueprint for 'Smart Distribution,' featuring over 100 trailer parking spots and 70 dock doors with real-time tracking for incoming shipments (GE Appliances News, 2019)."]
job_title: Senior Transportation Manager Deployment, Intermodal, SFG, and LTL

hook: NRS recently highlighted their expansion in the Southeast market, specifically focusing on increased drayage and warehouse capacity near the Port of Savannah to handle rising retail volumes (Company News, 2024).
overview: National Retail Systems (NRS) is a family-owned third-party logistics provider specializing in end-to-end retail supply chain solutions, including drayage, trucking, and distribution.
company_bullets: ["Operates approximately 2.5 million square feet of warehouse space across major hubs including NJ, CA, GA, and OH (NRS Corporate Overview)", "Maintains a significant drayage presence at the Ports of NY/NJ, Los Angeles, Long Beach, and Savannah (Company Website)", "The fleet consists of over 850 power units and 5,000+ trailers, indicating a high need for secure asset parking and yard management (FMCSA/Company Data)", "Specializes in 'ultimate' retail logistics, providing store-ready deliveries for major national big-box retailers (LinkedIn Profile)"]

hook: Announced plans to open at least 12 new Nordstrom Rack locations in 2026, increasing regional logistics pressure on their 12-center DC network (TheStreet, Jan 2026).
overview: Nordstrom is a leading fashion retailer that operates a diverse portfolio of luxury department stores, Nordstrom Rack off-price locations, and a robust e-commerce platform.
company_bullets: ["Operates 12 strategically placed distribution and fulfillment centers across the US, including major hubs in Riverside, CA and Elizabethtown, PA (SupplierWiki, Dec 2025)", "Utilizes a West Coast Omni Center (WCOC) that leverages dynamic routing algorithms and automation to drive double the fulfillment volume of traditional centers (Procurement Magazine, Jan 2026)", "Logistics strategy mandates strict appointment-based carrier arrivals and GS1-128 labeling to maintain high-velocity inventory flow through the DC network (SupplyPike, Dec 2025)"]

hook: Recognized as a Top Company for Innovation in Software Engineering at the RVA Tech Awards in early 2025, highlighting their aggressive push into AI and automated logistics management.
overview: Century Supply Chain Solutions is a global digital logistics provider and freight forwarder specializing in ocean transport, purchase order management, and technology-driven supply chain optimization through its proprietary VIZIV platform.
company_bullets: ["Operates a strategic network of CTPAT-compliant warehouses in U.S. port cities including Los Angeles/Long Beach (260k sq ft), Savannah (x3), and Newark (x3) (centurysc.com)", "Acquired by private equity firm Sun Capital Partners in June 2021 to accelerate its digital transformation and global expansion (Sun Capital PR, Jun 2021)", "Is a key participant in the Biden administration's FLOW (Freight Logistics Optimization Works) initiative, sharing real-time data to improve U.S. supply chain visibility (Supply Chain Dive, May 2023)"]

hook: Chief Operating Officer Andrew Rotondi recently detailed plans to double the number of their facilities over the next five years, focusing on larger, more efficient operations as part of their 2026 expansion strategy (Supply Chain World, Dec 2025).
overview: Dynamic Worldwide is a global third-party logistics (3PL) and supply chain provider specializing in fulfillment, distribution, and end-to-end transportation for the apparel, retail, and wholesale industries.
company_bullets: ["Operates a fleet of 500 trucks and thousands of trailers with a refresh cycle every three years to maintain high safety and EPA fuel standards (sangrupo.com)", "Manages over 3 million square feet of distribution space in North America with key hubs in North Bergen, NJ and Santa Fe Springs, CA (dynamiconline.com)", "Focusing on 2026 digital upgrades to their TMS and advanced storage technologies to optimize space efficiency in high-cost port-proximate real estate (Supply Chain World, Dec 2025)"]

hook: Expansion of the Greensboro, NC distribution center to include a 1.2M sq ft dry grocery warehouse and the upcoming $136M frozen foods facility in West Jacksonville (expected 2027).
overview: Publix Super Markets is one of the largest employee-owned supermarket chains in the United States, operating as a major regional retailer and manufacturer of food products.

hook: Opened a new 285,000-square-foot rental distribution center in Aurora, Illinois, to enable next-day delivery for Midwest stores (June 2024).

hook: Opened its 10th and largest distribution center in Maumelle, Arkansas and recently broke ground on an 11th facility in Nampa, Idaho scheduled for 2026 completion (Jan 2025)
overview: Tractor Supply Company is the largest rural lifestyle retailer in the United States, providing a wide range of products for home improvement, agriculture, lawn care, and livestock.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 10 primary distribution centers across 10 states, including its newest and largest facility in Maumelle, AR (tractorsupply.com, Jan 2025)", "Relies on a 'compact network' of core strategic carrier partners rather than an owned fleet to manage 24/7 distribution yard operations (FreightWaves, June 2022)", "Announced a $225M investment to build an 865,000 sq ft distribution center in Nampa, ID to serve 200+ stores in the Pacific Northwest by late 2026 (Business Wire, April 2025)"]

hook: Announced plans for a new $225M, 865,000-square-foot distribution center in Nampa, Idaho, scheduled for completion in late 2026 to support Northwest expansion (Tractor Supply PR, Jan 2025).
overview: Tractor Supply Co is the largest rural lifestyle retailer in the United States, providing a wide range of products for home improvement, agriculture, livestock, and pet care.
company_bullets: ["Opened its 10th and largest distribution center in Maumelle, Arkansas in 2024 to support store growth (Tractor Supply Q4 Earnings, Jan 2025)", "Targets 100 new store openings in 2026, supported by the acquisition of 18 former Big Lots locations (Retail TouchPoints, July 2025)", "Launched 'Life Out Here 2030' strategy, aiming to increase its total store count to 3,200 locations (SEC Form 8-K, Dec 2024)", "Scaling an in-house final-mile delivery team for large items to improve customer satisfaction and reduce return rates (Supply Chain Dive, Dec 2024)"]

hook: Opened its 10th and largest distribution center in 2024 and recently announced plans to build an 11th distribution center as part of its 'Life Out Here 2030' strategy (Jan 2025).
overview: Tractor Supply Company is the largest rural lifestyle retailer in the United States, providing a wide range of products including home improvement, agriculture, lawn and garden maintenance, and livestock and pet care.
company_bullets: ["Operates 10 distribution centers as of early 2025, with plans to break ground on an 11th facility this year to support a long-term goal of 3,200 stores (tractorsupply.com, Jan 2025)", "Strategy emphasizes 'big and bulky' last-mile delivery, aiming to increase in-house delivery coverage of large items from 15% to over 90% by 2030 (Supply Chain Dive, Dec 2024)", "Maintains a logistics philosophy focused on long-term strategic partnerships with a compact network of core carriers rather than annual bidding (FreightWaves, June 2022)"]

company_bullets: ["Operates 9 primary distribution centers globally, with key U.S. facilities in Mississippi, Nevada, and Kentucky (2023 10-K Filing)", "Is actively shifting to a 'Direct-to-Consumer' (DTC) first model, requiring high-velocity fulfillment operations at their distribution hubs (LS&Co. Investor Day 2024)", "Invested significantly in automating the Dorval, Quebec distribution center to increase processing capacity and efficiency (Modern Materials Handling, June 2023)"]

hook: Achieved a 2025 Silver Rating from EcoVadis for sustainability (Oct 13, 2025), reflecting a 13-point score increase and heightened focus on responsible procurement and ethical operations.
overview: LifeMade Products LLC is a manufacturer of temperature-controlled packaging and sustainable consumer goods, operating as a subsidiary of Jadex Inc.
company_bullets: ["Operates out of 9 facilities across the US, UK, and Puerto Rico as part of the Jadex Inc. network (press release, Oct 2025)", "Maintains a major manufacturing and headquarters presence in Greer, South Carolina, following its 2020 rebranding from Lifoam Industries (Business Wire, March 2020)", "Employs approximately 501\u2013691 personnel focused on plastics manufacturing and temperature-control solutions for healthcare and retail (LeadIQ/LinkedIn, 2025)"]

hook: Matson Logistics is navigating a shift in demand toward e-commerce and high-value e-goods, with a strong focus on its expedited China-to-California services and off-dock terminal operations (Annual Report, Feb 2025).
overview: Matson Logistics is a subsidiary of Matson, Inc. that provides integrated North American logistics services, including warehousing, distribution, transloading, and multimodal transportation via rail and highway.
company_bullets: ["Operates critical warehousing and distribution facilities in strategic hubs, including two in Georgia (Savannah) and two in Northern California (Oakland) (Company 10-K, Feb 2025)", "Its subsidiary Span Alaska operates a major cross-dock facility in Auburn, Washington, and a network of service centers across Alaska (Company 10-K, Feb 2025)", "Logistics segment revenue reached $612.1 million in 2024, focusing on supply chain management and asset-light brokerage (PR Newswire, Feb 2025)"]

hook: Announced a strategic initiative in March 2025 to open 100 new stores this fiscal year, increasing pressure on existing regional distribution hubs to manage higher trailer volumes (Ross Stores Investor Relations).
overview: Ross Stores, Inc. is a major off-price apparel and home fashion retailer operating the Ross Dress for Less and dd's DISCOUNTS brands across the United States.
company_bullets: ["Operates 9 massive regional distribution centers totaling approximately 12.8 million square feet across California, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, Georgia, and Texas (Ross Stores 10-K Filing)", "Executing a long-term growth plan to reach 3,600 stores nationwide, which will require significant future investment in logistics infrastructure and gate automation (Supply Chain Dive, Sept 2025)", "Maintains a high-velocity 'push' distribution model where nearly all merchandise is processed through DCs rather than held in back-of-store inventory, making yard efficiency critical (Company Operations Profile, Oct 2025)"]
job_title: Global Vice President, Sourcing Supply Chain

hook: Participating in the Las Vegas Market (Jan 2026) to showcase specialized white-glove furniture and appliance delivery and storage solutions (company website)
overview: Speedy Delivery LLC is a 3PL and last-mile logistics provider specializing in white-glove home delivery, pool distribution, and warehouse fulfillment for furniture and appliances.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 9 regional warehouse and distribution hubs across the Western US and New York, including Los Angeles, Seattle, and Chicago (company website)", "Specializes in 'Pool Distribution' services, using regional warehouses to sort and consolidate small shipments (100\u201310,000 lbs) for last-mile delivery (company website)", "Maintains an active freight brokerage authority (MC855542) but reports zero power units and zero drivers on its federal safety profile, indicating a reliance on owner-operators or contract carriers (FMCSA, Jan 2026)"]

hook: Officially opened its largest ever flagship distribution center in Ashland, VA (Oct 2025), featuring the company's first automated product-picking system.
overview: SanMar is the largest supplier of wholesale imprintable clothing and accessories in the United States, providing apparel from over 30 brands to decorators and promotional product distributors.
company_bullets: ["Operates a national network of 9 distribution centers covering over 7.8 million square feet of inventory space (SanMar website)", "Completed a $50M investment in a new 1.1M sq ft East Coast flagship facility in Hanover County, VA, which became fully operational in late 2025 (Graphics Pro, Oct 2025)", "Launched its first automated product-picking system in 2025, utilizing a fleet of automated units across a 125,000-square-foot grid (PR Newswire, Oct 2025)"]

hook: Reported a 34% revenue surge in Feb 2025 and was named to Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies list in March 2025 for its logistics technology and AI-driven growth.
overview: Spreetail is a global ecommerce logistics and marketplace accelerator that specializes in the warehousing, selling, and fulfillment of big-and-bulky products across major online marketplaces.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 7 fulfillment centers in the U.S. and 2 international locations to achieve 80% next-day delivery coverage (company website)", "Specializes in 'big-and-bulky' and hard-to-ship products, requiring specialized LTL operations and large-scale warehouse security (company website)", "Recently expanded global footprint to over 10 new countries and integrated AI-powered insights through the acquisition of Echo (Business Wire, March 2025)"]

hook: Quiet Platforms significantly expanded its 'edge' delivery network in late 2023 and 2024 by integrating regional carriers to compete with national providers (Supply Chain Dive, Dec 2023).
overview: Quiet Platforms, a subsidiary of American Eagle Outfitters (AEO), operates an open-access logistics network designed to provide enterprise-level fulfillment and delivery services for various retailers.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 8 primary distribution centers in the U.S., Canada, and Mexico totaling approximately 5 million square feet (AEO 2023 10-K)", "Leverages an 'open-sharing' platform model to pool logistics assets for over 60 different retail brands (Quiet Platforms Website)", "Focuses on a 'plug-and-play' logistics infrastructure to reduce last-mile costs and delivery times for mid-market retailers (Modern Retail, Jan 2024)"]

hook: Announced a major logistics expansion with a new distribution center in Madison, Alabama, to support their push into the Mid-West and Southeast markets (January 2024).
overview: BJ's Wholesale Club is a leading operator of membership warehouse clubs in the Eastern United States, providing a wide array of groceries, electronics, and general merchandise.
company_bullets: ["Operates 7 core distribution centers (3 perishable, 4 dry) plus a new facility in Madison, AL to support expanding footprint (Company 10-K, March 2024)", "Acquired the perishable supply chain and four distribution centers from Burris Logistics to bring end-to-end logistics in-house (BJ's Press Release, 2022)", "Maintains a private fleet of 104 power units and 154 drivers, though heavily supplemented by dedicated third-party logistics partners (FMCSA SAFER Data, 2024)"]

hook: Announced the development of a new 1.2 million-square-foot distribution center in Rogersville, Missouri to support long-term growth (September 2024).
overview: Bass Pro Shops is a leading North American outdoor retailer specializing in hunting, fishing, camping, and related outdoor recreation merchandise, operating under the Bass Pro Shops and Cabela's brands.
company_bullets: ["Currently modernizing logistics by building a massive new 1.2 million-square-foot 'Nature's Best' distribution center in Rogersville, MO to replace older facilities (Springfield Business Journal, Sept 2024)", "Operates major distribution hubs inherited from the Cabela's merger, including a 1.2M sq ft facility in Sidney, Nebraska and a 600k sq ft facility in Tooele, Utah (Cabela's Real Estate Overview)", "Logistics strategy heavily prioritizes omnichannel fulfillment, integrating retail store inventory with online distribution to compete with Amazon (SupplyChainBrain, 2023)"]

hook: Recently rebranded SDI Element Logic to Element Logic in October 2024 to unify its global brand and accelerate expansion into the Americas following its acquisition of ABCO Systems.
overview: Element Logic is a global technology company specializing in intelligent warehouse automation and is the world's first and largest AutoStore system integrator.
company_bullets: ["Operates 8 primary locations across the U.S. and maintains a presence in five Latin American countries following its acquisition of SDI Industries (Supply Chain Management Review, March 2022)", "Acquired ABCO Systems in 2024 to further expand its U.S. footprint in the automated storage and material handling sector (elementlogic.net, 2024)", "The company focuses on warehouse automation integration rather than logistics fulfillment, meaning their physical sites serve as engineering hubs, showrooms, and regional offices rather than high-volume freight DCs (elementlogic.net, Jan 2026)"]

hook: Filed a lawsuit in July 2025 against Brightline to halt passenger service expansions, citing concerns over track capacity and the need for significant infrastructure investment to handle increased volumes safely (Jax Daily Record, Aug 2025).
overview: Florida East Coast Railway (FEC) is a Class II regional railroad operating a 351-mile mainline between Jacksonville and Miami, serving as the exclusive rail provider for three major South Florida ports.
company_bullets: ["Operates 8 primary intermodal terminals and rail yards including Bowden Yard (Jacksonville), Hialeah Yard (Miami), and facilities at PortMiami, Port Everglades, and Port of Palm Beach (company website)", "Acquired by Grupo M\u00e9xico Transportes in 2017; currently undergoing a multi-year corporate rebranding and locomotive fleet update as of early 2024 (YouTube / Industry News, Jan 2024)", "Operates a significant trucking and drayage arm through subsidiaries Raven Transport and Florida Express Carriers to provide door-to-door regional delivery across the Southeast (fecrwy.com)"]

hook: Garick's leadership in the U.S. compost market is gaining momentum as the industry is projected to reach a $2.5 billion valuation by 2032 (Jan 2026).
overview: Garick is a leading manufacturer, distributor, and processor of sustainable natural resource products, specializing in mulch, soil, organic recycling, and biomass for the landscaping and construction industries.
company_bullets: ["Operates 8 primary processing and bagging facilities across CT, NC, OH, GA, KS, MN, and TN (shopgarick.com)", "Leverages a network of over 40 independent co-packers, terminals, and ports to distribute products across North America (shopgarick.com)", "Manages an annual throughput of over 3 million yards of bulk material for major retailers like Home Depot, Lowe's, and Menards (company website)"]

hook: Approved a massive $4.5 billion investment plan for the next decade, which includes expanding the Savannah Container Terminal and doubling warehouse space for Customs inspections (Oct 2024).
overview: The Georgia Ports Authority (GPA) is a state agency that owns and operates the deepwater ports of Savannah and Brunswick, along with several inland terminals, serving as a critical global logistics hub.
company_bullets: ["Operates 7 primary facilities including the 1,345-acre Garden City Terminal, the largest single-operator container terminal in North America (Wikipedia)", "Opened the $200 million Garden City Terminal West in 2024, a 100-acre facility providing storage for 20,000 containers to improve supply chain fluidity (gaports.com, May 2025)", "Handles approximately 14,000 to 15,000 daily truck transactions at the Port of Savannah, emphasizing a critical need for gate automation and traffic management (selectgeorgia.com, 2025)"]

hook: Michaels announced the closure of its Tracy, CA distribution center (effective August 2025) as part of a broader strategy to optimize its distribution network and better serve its 1,200+ stores.
overview: Michaels is the largest arts and crafts specialty retailer in North America, operating over 1,200 stores and a complex logistics network to support DIY, home décor, and framing products.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of distribution centers in locations including Lancaster (CA), Fort Worth (TX), Haslet (TX), Hazleton (PA), Jacksonville (FL), New Lenox (IL), and Centralia (WA) (Indeed company profiles)", "Closed a major 750,000 sq ft distribution center in Tracy, CA in August 2025, laying off 229 employees to consolidate its logistics footprint (CBS News, June 2025)", "Expanded its Winslow, NJ facility (former AC Moore HQ) to include 556 total tractor-trailer parking spaces to support fulfillment operations (42 Freeway, news archive)"]

overview: Canadian Tire Corporation is a major Canadian retail conglomerate operating across multiple banners including Canadian Tire, SportChek, Mark's, and Helly Hansen, specializing in automotive, hardware, sports, and apparel.
company_bullets: ["Opening a new regional distribution center in Metro Vancouver in 2025 to expand Western Canada capacity (Canadian Tire Q4 2024 Report, Feb 2025)", "Fully operationalized 'goods-to-person' robotics and automation at major Calgary and Montreal distribution centers to increase throughput (Company Press Release, Nov 2024)", "Acquired a 25% stake in Ashcroft Terminal, BC's largest inland port, to shift volume from trucks to rail and improve supply chain flexibility (RetailWire)"]

hook: Finalizing the $6.7B acquisition of Pactiv Evergreen in Q2 2025, which will create one of the largest North American packaging footprints with over 100 combined production facilities (Jan 2026).
overview: Novolex is a leading global manufacturer of diverse packaging products for the foodservice, retail, and industrial markets, specializing in plastic, paper, and sustainable materials.
company_bullets: ["Operates over 100 production facilities and 7 Regional Mixing Centers strategically located across North America and Europe (Novolex.com)", "Acquired Pactiv Evergreen for $6.7B in a deal expected to close by mid-2025, significantly expanding their logistics and manufacturing scale (Packaging Dive, Dec 2024)", "Employs a hub-and-spoke distribution network to service over 250 brands and 39,000 SKUs globally (Novolex.com)"]

hook: Foot Locker is currently executing its 'Lace Up' strategic plan, which includes a massive supply chain overhaul to modernize its distribution network by 2026 (March 2023 Strategy Update).
overview: Foot Locker, Inc. is a leading global footwear and apparel retailer operating a portfolio of brands including Foot Locker, Kids Foot Locker, Champs Sports, and atmos.
company_bullets: ["Operates primary distribution centers in Junction City (KS), Camp Hill (PA), Reno (NV), and Heerenveen (Netherlands) totaling over 4 million sq. ft. (2023 10-K Filing)", "Investing in 'omni-conversions' of existing warehouses to handle both store replenishment and direct-to-consumer fulfillment from the same site (Supply Chain Dive, 2023)", "The company closed its Wausau, Wisconsin distribution facility in late 2022 to consolidate logistics operations into larger, more automated hubs (Wausau Pilot & Review, Sept 2022)"]

hook: PetSmart recently shifted 90% of its online order fulfillment from its 7 distribution centers directly to its 1,600+ retail stores to decrease delivery times and costs (Modern Retail, April 2025).
overview: PetSmart is the largest specialty pet retailer in North America, providing a broad range of pet products, grooming, training, and veterinary services through its extensive network of superstores.
company_bullets: ["Operates 7 primary distribution centers across the U.S., including locations in Reno, NV, Bethel, PA, and Newnan, GA (LifeAtPetSmart, May 2025)", "Leverages the federal Freight Logistics Optimization Works (FLOW) platform to predict supply chain delays and optimize gate moves and chassis availability (Supply Chain Dive, March 2024)", "Logistics network encompasses over 5.3 million square feet of warehouse space and services over 14,000 unique SKUs (PetSmart Careers Page, Jan 2026)"]

hook: SVT Supply Chain Solutions specializes in complex 'transition services' such as managing supply chain shifts during mergers, acquisitions, and divestitures, offering a unique entry point for infrastructure discussions (kurrant.ai).
overview: SVT Supply Chain Solutions (also known as Sea View Technologies) is a 3PL and global logistics provider specializing in inventory management, global sourcing, order fulfillment, and reverse logistics.
company_bullets: ["Provides integrated 3PL services including global warehouse locations, reverse logistics, and specialized electronics shortage resolution (svtsupplychain.com)", "Acts as a strategic partner for Fortune 500 companies and small businesses alike, offering customized internal supply chain transition services (kurrant.ai)", "Operates as a privately held entity founded in 1997 with a focus on high-visibility inventory management across multiple locations (svtsupplychain.com)"]

hook: Broke ground on a new Northern California distribution center in Tracy, CA in September 2025 to replace its Union City facility and expand self-distribution capabilities.
overview: Sprouts Farmers Market is a high-growth specialty grocer focusing on fresh, natural, and organic products, particularly produce which accounts for roughly 20% of sales.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 7 distribution centers in Aurora, CO; Union City, CA; Fullerton, CA; Glendale, AZ; Orlando, FL; Wilmer, TX; and East Point, GA (sprouts.com, Oct 2023)", "Outsources transportation and warehouse management to third-party logistics partners including Penske Logistics and Lineage (The Produce News, Jan 2026)", "Strategy involves a '250-mile radius' model where distribution centers are strategically located within 250 miles of the stores they serve to ensure product freshness (The Packer, Oct 2025)"]

hook: Beginning in Q1 2026, the company will exit low-performing categories like men's grooming to reduce inventory complexity and optimize their supply chain network (Supply Chain Dive, Dec 2025)
overview: Bath & Body Works is a major global retailer specializing in personal care, home fragrance, and soaps, operating over 1,800 company-owned stores in North America and an extensive international franchise network.
company_bullets: ["Operates 6 primary company-owned distribution and fulfillment centers concentrated in central Ohio (bbwinc.com, Nov 2024)", "Manages an agile, vertically integrated supply chain with ~80% of production based in the U.S., centered around 'Beauty Park' in New Albany, OH (MatrixBCG, Sept 2025)", "Supplements its core network with third-party-operated regional distribution centers across North America to position inventory closer to its 1,900+ retail locations (SEC 10-K filing, FY2024)"]

hook: Partnered with DHL Supply Chain to open a massive 1.2 million-square-foot automated distribution center in Fort Worth, Texas, which became operational in late 2024 (SGB Media, April 2023).
overview: Carhartt is a premier American manufacturer of heavy-duty workwear, hunting apparel, and fire-resistant clothing for manual laborers and outdoor enthusiasts.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 6 distribution centers across Tennessee, Kentucky, Ohio, and Texas to support its retail, wholesale, and e-commerce channels (Modern Materials Handling, May 2023)", "Expanded its distribution footprint by 400% since 2017, transitioning from a single DC to a highly automated multi-hub network (Supply Chain 24/7, May 2023)", "Announced a multi-year partnership with Ford in January 2026 to launch a co-branded 2027 Super Duty truck and support skilled trades education (AutoGuide, Jan 2026)"]

hook: Announced construction of a new 800,000-square-foot regional distribution center in Fort Worth, Texas, featuring advanced automation and set to open in early 2026 (PR Newswire, Aug 2024).
overview: DICK'S Sporting Goods is the leading omnichannel sporting goods retailer in the United States, providing a vast selection of high-quality equipment, apparel, footwear, and accessories through its massive store network and digital platforms.
company_bullets: ["Operates a primary network of 5 distribution centers located in Atlanta (GA), Conklin (NY), Goodyear (AZ), Plainfield (IN), and Smithton (PA), with a 6th facility under construction (Supply Chain Dive, Aug 2024)", "Leverages a 'stores-as-hubs' strategy where approximately 90% of e-commerce orders are fulfilled directly from retail locations rather than DCs (PortersFiveForce.com, Sept 2025)", "Allocating approximately $1 billion in capital expenditures for 2025 to support store growth, high-tech experiential formats like 'House of Sport,' and supply chain modernization (SEC Form 10-K, Mar 2025)"]

company_bullets: ["Operates a primary network of 5 distribution centers located in Atlanta (GA), Conklin (NY), Goodyear (AZ), Plainfield (IN), and Smithton (PA), with a 6th facility under construction (Supply Chain Dive, Aug 2024)", "Leverages a 'stores-as-hubs' strategy where approximately 90% of e-commerce orders are fulfilled directly from retail locations rather than DCs (PortersFiveForce.com, Sept 2025)", "Allocating approximately $1 billion in capital expenditures for 2025 to support store growth, high-tech experiential formats like 'House of Sport,' and supply chain modernization (SEC Form 10-K, Mar 2025)"]

hook: Reported a significant 23.1% increase in quarterly net sales to $1.0 billion (Dec 2025) while continuing expansion toward a long-term goal of 3,500 stores.
overview: Five Below is a leading high-growth value retailer offering a wide range of trend-right products, most priced between $1 and $5, targeting the tween and teen demographic.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 6 primary distribution centers (ShipCenters) located in New Jersey, Georgia, Texas, Mississippi, Indiana, and Arizona (Five Below Investor Relations, 2025)", "Opened a 1 million-square-foot high-tech Midwest distribution hub in Shelby County, Indiana, which became fully operational in 2022 to support regional density (Area Development, May 2021)", "The company predominantly relies on contract carriers for outbound logistics rather than owning a large private tractor fleet (SEC Form 10-K, 2024)"]

hook: Growing its South Carolina footprint with a new $30 million research, development, and innovation facility in Anderson County expected to be online in late 2025 (South Carolina Department of Commerce, Nov 2024).
