hook: Nearing completion of a $1.4 billion infrastructure program, including the deepest and widest shipping channels on the U.S. East Coast by February 2026 (Port of Virginia Press Release, Jan 2026)
overview: The Port of Virginia is a state-owned port authority that operates six major general cargo terminals and serves as a primary East Coast hub for containerized, breakbulk, and roll-on/roll-off cargo.
company_bullets: ["Operates six primary terminal facilities: Norfolk International Terminals, Virginia International Gateway, Portsmouth Marine Terminal, Newport News Marine Terminal, Virginia Inland Port, and Richmond Marine Terminal (company website)", "Implemented a $450 million dredging project to create 55-foot deep channels capable of supporting two-way traffic for ultra-large container vessels by early 2026 (Marine Log, Jan 2026)", "Added 15 shuttle trucks to its operations in 2022 to assist with record-breaking cargo volumes, though the port primarily relies on a massive network of over 15,000 independent motor carriers (Port of Virginia Press Release, July 2022)"]

hook: Partnered with Walmart in August 2025 to install automated AutoFill systems across five 'Next Generation Fulfillment Centers' in Pennsylvania, Illinois, Texas, and California.
overview: Ranpak Holdings Corp. is a leading global manufacturer of sustainable paper-based packaging materials and automated end-of-line packaging systems for e-commerce and industrial supply chains.
company_bullets: ["Operates primary production and office facilities in Concord (OH), Reno (NV), Kansas City (MO), the Netherlands, Czech Republic, and Singapore (Wikipedia).", "Announced a major partnership with Medline in January 2026 to deploy sustainable packaging automation across Medline's high-volume distribution sites (Modern Materials Handling, Jan 2026).", "Relies on a global network of over 250 exclusive distribution partners to deliver products rather than maintaining a private trucking fleet (Ranpak About Us)."]

hook: SC Ports recently reported a 10% year-over-year increase in container volumes for November 2024, highlighting the growing pressure on terminal gate throughput and regional distribution capacity (SCPA News, Dec 2024).
overview: South Carolina Ports (SC Ports) owns and operates the Port of Charleston and two inland ports, serving as a critical global gateway for the Southeast through containerized, breakbulk, and roll-on/roll-off cargo operations.
company_bullets: ["Operates six major terminals including Wando Welch, North Charleston, and the high-tech Hugh K. Leatherman Terminal (company website)", "Investing $418 million in the Navy Base Intermodal Facility to streamline rail-to-ship transfers and optimize terminal gate traffic (2024 SCPA Master Plan)", "Inland Port Greer and Inland Port Dillon extend the port's reach into the interior, requiring sophisticated gate security for high-volume truck-to-rail transitions (SCPA operations overview)"]

hook: Allocated 29 million levs (approx. $16M) specifically for warehouse expansion and 14.3 million levs for vehicle fleet growth in 2024 (SeeNews, Feb 2025).
overview: Speedy AD is the leading courier and logistics service provider in Bulgaria, offering domestic and international parcel delivery, cargo transport, and warehousing solutions.
company_bullets: ["Operates a logistics network including 6 distribution centers and over 800 offices and lockers across 100% of Bulgaria (Bulgarian Business Leaders Forum / company website)", "Invested 61.8 million levs in 2024 with a primary focus on warehouse capacity expansion and the acquisition of new delivery vehicles (SeeNews, Feb 2025)", "Maintains a fleet of over 1,700 vehicles to support a volume of more than 80 million completed deliveries annually (company website / SeeNews, Feb 2025)"]

hook: Ulta Beauty is currently undergoing a 'Project Redesign' transformation, which includes the 2024 completion of their new Market Distribution Center in Greer, South Carolina, to optimize East Coast fulfillment.
overview: Ulta Beauty is the largest specialty beauty retailer in the United States, offering a massive assortment of cosmetics, fragrances, skin care products, and salon services through its retail stores and e-commerce platform.
company_bullets: ["Operates six primary distribution centers located in Romeoville, IL; Franklin, IN; Chambersburg, PA; Dallas, TX; Greenwood, IN; and Fresno, CA (Ulta Beauty 2023 10-K)", "Completed a major expansion of the Dallas, TX distribution center in 2023 to include a new Market Distribution Center (MDC) segment (Ulta Beauty Investor Relations, March 2024)", "Supply chain strategy focuses on a 'hub and spoke' model to increase frequency of store deliveries while reducing lead times for e-commerce (Supply Chain Dive, April 2024)"]

hook: Lands' End announced in March 2025 that its Board of Directors has initiated a process to explore strategic alternatives, including a potential sale or merger, to maximize shareholder value.

company_bullets: ["Operates four primary distribution centers located in Sumner, WA; Goodyear, AZ; Bedford, PA; and Lebanon, TN (REI Co-op Newsroom, 2024)", "The 400,000-square-foot Lebanon, TN facility is designed to support more than 70 stores and 5.6 million members in the East (REI Press Release, Jan 2024)", "Utilizes 100% renewable energy and LEED Platinum certification standards for its latest distribution facility infrastructure (REI 2023 Impact Report)", "Relies on third-party carriers and dedicated contract carriage for store replenishment rather than a private tractor fleet (Supply Chain Dive analysis)"]

hook: Began full operations at its new 400,000-square-foot high-tech distribution center in Lebanon, Tennessee, to optimize East Coast fulfillment (January 2024)
overview: REI (Recreational Equipment Inc.) is the United States' largest consumer co-operative, specializing in outdoor recreation gear, apparel, and footwear through retail stores and e-commerce.
company_bullets: ["Operates four primary regional distribution centers located in Sumner, WA; Bedford, PA; Goodyear, AZ; and Lebanon, TN (REI 2023 Stewardship Report)", "The Lebanon, TN facility is designed to support more than 70 stores and features advanced automation to process 120,000 pieces of inventory daily (REI Newsroom, Jan 2024)", "Outsources heavy freight and tractor-trailer operations to third-party logistics providers while focusing on internal warehouse management and facility security (Inbound Logistics)"]

hook: Showcased new e-commerce fulfillment and last-mile delivery innovations at the RILA LINK 2025 Retail Supply Chain Conference (Feb 2025)
overview: Reliable Logistics is a Canadian 3PL provider specializing in e-commerce fulfillment, last-mile delivery, and cross-border freight management between Canada and the U.S.

hook: Dow Jones recently announced that its Factiva platform surpassed 8,000 licensed sources for GenAI use (Jan 20, 2026), reflecting a continued pivot toward digital infrastructure over physical print assets.
overview: The Wall Street Journal is a global, business-focused daily newspaper and digital media outlet published by Dow Jones & Company, a subsidiary of News Corp.
company_bullets: ["Operates only 4 remaining owned-and-operated printing plants in Chicopee (MA), White Oak (MD), LaGrange (GA), and Federal Way (WA) as of 2022 (IAPE 1096, Feb 2022)", "Closed the Bronx printing facility in May 2021 and moved production to a New York Times-owned plant in Queens to reduce overhead (CEO Almar Latour memo, May 2021)", "Actively shifting from self-managed logistics to contract printing and third-party delivery services to manage declining print circulation (iape1096.org, Feb 2022)"]

hook: Transformco has officially pivoted to a real estate operating company model as of 2024, focusing on redeveloping its remaining massive distribution centers in PA, KS, FL, and CA into multi-tenant logistics hubs.
overview: Transformco is the private holding company formed to acquire the assets of Sears Holdings, operating a remaining footprint of Sears and Kmart stores while pivoting toward real estate redevelopment and third-party logistics.
company_bullets: ["Operates the 'Transform Warehouse Operations' (TWO) network consisting of 4 major distribution centers totaling 4.7M sq. ft. in Fairless Hills, PA; Lawrence, KS; Ocala, FL; and Tejon, CA (transformwo.com)", "Sold its primary delivery fleet and 'middle mile' logistics arm, Innovel Solutions, to Costco for $1 billion in March 2020, significantly reducing its direct fleet operations (PR Newswire, Mar 2020)", "Strategy shifted in late 2023 to becoming a 'real estate operating company,' focusing on leasing its massive yard spaces\u2014some with over 750 trailer spots\u2014to third-party logistics providers (Wikipedia/Company Interview, June 2023)"]

hook: Announced a major expansion in May 2025, leasing a new 330,000 sq ft facility in West Chester, Ohio, to house its relocated Innovation and Support Center and increase manufacturing footprint (DC Velocity, May 2025).
overview: Trew is a U.S.-based manufacturer and systems integrator that provides automated material handling solutions, including conveyor systems and warehouse execution software, for the retail, e-commerce, and distribution industries.
company_bullets: ["Operates a total footprint of nearly 595,000 square feet across its Southwest Ohio campus, including specialized facilities for parts fulfillment and project staging (trewautomation.com)", "Completed its fourth major facility expansion in six years as of May 2025, tripling the size of its Technology and Education Center (REDI Cincinnati, April 2024; DC Velocity, May 2025)", "Received significant growth investment from American Industrial Partners (AIP) to scale manufacturing capacity and advanced automation product offerings (Modern Materials Handling, Aug 2023)"]

company_bullets: ["Operates three primary distribution centers located in Ankeny (IA), Terre Haute (IN), and Joplin (MO) which serve as central hubs for its internal logistics network (company 10-K, June 2024)", "Maintains a private fleet of approximately 526 commercial motor vehicles for self-distribution of 90% of in-store products and fuel (Federal Register, April 2025)", "Currently implementing a three-year strategic plan to add 500 total stores by the end of fiscal 2026, significantly increasing demand on their regional logistics infrastructure (C-Store Dive, June 2025)"]

hook: Implemented a new AI-based product allocation system in early 2025 to optimize inventory distribution across its store fleet (April 2025).

hook: Closed its legacy Dubuque fulfillment center in October 2024 to consolidate operations into its highly automated, flagship 500,000 sq. ft. facility in Adairsville, Georgia (Supply Chain Dive, Dec 2024).
overview: Duluth Trading Company is a lifestyle retailer specializing in durable workwear, outdoor apparel, and accessories, primarily serving the self-reliant American market through e-commerce and its own retail stores.
company_bullets: ["Operates a network of 3 active fulfillment centers in Adairsville (GA), Belleville (WI), and Salt Lake City (UT) following the Q4 2024 closure of their Iowa facility (Supply Chain Dive, Dec 2024).", "The flagship Adairsville DC now processes over 65% of total network volume using advanced robotics and Manhattan Active Warehouse Management (PR Newswire, Sept 2023).", "Registered as a private carrier with only 2 power units and 5 drivers, indicating a heavy reliance on third-party logistics (3PL) and parcel carriers like UPS/FedEx for final mile and linehaul (FMCSA SAFER, Dec 2025)."]

hook: Everlast's parent company, Frasers Group, announced a major multi-year investment into 'Project Elevate' to automate its global distribution network, including a new 2.4 million sq ft logistics hub (October 2024).
overview: Everlast Sports Manufacturing is a global designer, manufacturer, and licensor of boxing, mixed martial arts, and fitness equipment, operating under the Frasers Group (Sports Direct) umbrella.
company_bullets: ["Primary North American distribution is centralized through a major facility in Moberly, Missouri, which manages manufacturing and global shipping (Everlast Corporate History)", "Logistics and fulfillment are increasingly integrated into the Frasers Group 'Shirebrook' mega-DC ecosystem to streamline international retail distribution (Frasers Group Investor Relations, 2024)", "Everlast has shifted its business model to focus heavily on direct-to-consumer (DTC) e-commerce, requiring high-velocity fulfillment center security (Modern Materials Handling, 2023)"]

hook: Announced the expansion of their 'Megafactory' in Colombia on January 28, 2025, to increase logistics capacity and meet growing Latin American demand.

hook: Fulcrum Collective recently expanded its food portfolio with an investment in the food products company Sunnie on June 18, 2025 (PitchBook).

hook: Port Freeport recently opened an 80,000 sq. ft. refrigerated cross-dock facility and acquired a contiguous 100-acre parcel for terminal expansion and modernized truck queuing (May 2025).
overview: Port Freeport is a major deep-water port and logistics hub on the Texas Gulf Coast, specializing in containerized cargo, Ro-Ro automotive transport, and refrigerated fruit imports.
company_bullets: ["Operates the Velasco Container Terminal and a newly opened 80,000 sq. ft. chilled cross-dock facility with 84 bay doors (company website, May 2025)", "Completed a $140M berth expansion (Berth 8) and is currently deepening the harbor channel to 51-56 feet to accommodate larger Neo-Panamax vessels by late 2025 (press release, Oct 2025)", "Serves as a major automotive hub, handling 162,239 vehicles in 2024, and recently opened a 120-acre vehicle processing center for Volkswagen Group of America (automotive logistics news, Feb 2025)"]

company_bullets: ["Operates as a pure freight broker and NVOCC with no internal fleet or physical warehouse assets (FMCSA SAFER Database, Jan 2026)", "Leverages proprietary cloud-based technology, Grapevine TMS, to manage global ecommerce and supply chain acceleration (backhauldirect.com)", "Maintains a high-tech focus on reducing 'empty miles' for their carrier network through advanced tracking and automated matching (backhaulers.io)"]

overview: Bamboo Rose is a leading collaborative product development, sourcing, and supply chain software platform that connects retailers and consumer brands with their global network of suppliers.

hook: Recently relaunched its 'Love Bites' heart-shaped pancake line with a strategic retail expansion and a mobile food truck tour in Texas (January 2026).
overview: Belgian Boys is a Brooklyn-based food brand that manufactures European-inspired refrigerated breakfast foods and snacks, distributing them to over 12,000 retail stores nationwide.
company_bullets: ["Products are manufactured in Europe and imported to the U.S., utilizing third-party logistics (3PL) partners for storage and nationwide distribution (Forbes, March 2025)", "Reached a major milestone of 12,000 retail locations including Walmart, Target, Costco, and Whole Foods (Company Website, Jan 2026)", "Operating as a lean team of approximately 28-41 employees, focusing on brand and product innovation while outsourcing heavy logistics (PitchBook / Owler, Jan 2026)"]

hook: Birdseye Security Solutions showcased its 'Voice from Above' remote monitoring technology at the TIA 2024 Capital Ideas Conference to address cargo theft and gate efficiency (April 2024).
overview: Birdseye Security Solutions provides AI-powered remote video monitoring and facility management services specializing in gate automation and perimeter security for logistics, trucking, and industrial sites.
company_bullets: ["Specializes in 'Virtual Gate' technology that replaces physical guards with remote agents to manage check-ins and BOL processing (Company Website)", "Operates a centralized North American monitoring station that manages over 800 cameras for logistics and yard management clients (LinkedIn)", "Focuses on preventing cargo theft and unauthorized access for third-party logistics (3PL) and trucking companies across North America (Birdseye Security Blog, 2024)"]

hook: Acquired returns management leader Optoro in August 2025 to integrate advanced AI-driven warehouse and in-store returns processing into their platform.
overview: Blue Yonder is a leading global provider of AI-driven supply chain management software, specializing in warehouse, transportation, and retail planning solutions.
company_bullets: ["Operates as a software vendor providing Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) to over 3,000 customers globally rather than operating its own facilities (company website)", "Completed the acquisition of One Network Enterprises for $839 million in August 2024 to create a unified end-to-end supply chain ecosystem (Wikipedia, Aug 2024)", "Launched a new AI Innovation Studio in Dallas to accelerate the development of agentic AI for logistics and warehouse operations (Business Wire, Nov 2024)"]

hook: Closed an $11 million Series A funding round to expand its drayage management platform and predictive empty container return features (February 2023).
overview: BlueCargo is a logistics SaaS platform that provides real-time container tracking and drayage management solutions to help freight forwarders and shippers optimize port operations.
company_bullets: ["Operates as a pure-play software-as-a-service (SaaS) provider for the supply chain, not a physical asset owner (Crunchbase)", "Platform aggregates data from over 60 terminals across North America to help users avoid demurrage and detention fees (Company Website)", "Currently monitors and tracks over 5,000 containers daily through its proprietary software interface (LinkedIn)"]

hook: BCG recently expanded its climate and sustainability practice, emphasizing the decarbonization of supply chains for their logistics clients (BCG Global News, December 2025).
overview: Boston Consulting Group (BCG) is a premier global management consulting firm that advises leading organizations on strategy, operations, and digital transformation.
company_bullets: ["BCG operates as a professional services firm and does not own or manage physical distribution centers or trucking fleets (Company Overview, 2025)", "The firm recently launched 'BCG X' to integrate tech-build and design capabilities, often consulting for major retailers on warehouse automation strategy (BCG Press Release, late 2024)", "The company reported record global revenues of $12.3 billion, reflecting high demand for strategic operational consulting rather than physical logistics execution (Annual Results, 2024)"]

hook: Launched 'Fleet Solutions' in 2025 following the acquisition of Sokolis to expand fuel management and procurement services for commercial fleets (Company Timeline, Jan 2026).
overview: Breakthrough Fuel provides transportation technology and managed services focused on fuel cost management, freight procurement, and decarbonization for enterprise shippers.
company_bullets: ["Provides market-based fuel reimbursement and decarbonization data for a network of shippers processing over 46.5 million shipments annually (Breakthrough Fuel Website, Jan 2026).", "A wholly-owned subsidiary of U.S. Venture, Inc. since 2019, providing access to broader energy and fuel distribution resources (PitchBook, 2025).", "Recently released the 2026 Freight Trends Report, highlighting data-driven strategies to address economic headwinds and driver compliance metrics (Breakthrough Fuel Report, Jan 2026)."]

hook: Showcased new Predictive Fulfillment technology at NRF 2024 to optimize omnichannel operations and reduce split shipments (Bricz Website, Jan 2024).
overview: Bricz is a global supply chain consulting firm that specializes in supply chain strategy, WMS implementation, and robotics/automation for retailers and distributors.
company_bullets: ["A leading implementation partner for Manhattan Associates solutions, having deployed over 250 sites globally (company website)", "Launched a dedicated Transportation Management Systems (TMS) practice in 2020 to assist clients with middle-mile optimization and freight cost control (company website)", "Serves high-profile logistics clients including NFI Industries, which operates over 31 million sq ft of distribution space (Bricz customer testimonials)"]

hook: Closed a $15.2M CAD Series A funding round to expand their tech stack and presence in international markets including the UK and Australia (BetaKit, June 2021).
overview: Browze is a direct-to-consumer e-commerce retailer that sources home and kitchen lifestyle products directly from factories to provide lower costs to consumers.
company_bullets: ["Operates a 'factory-to-consumer' model, negotiating directly with manufacturers to bypass traditional warehousing and distribution markups (Browze.com)", "Focused on international expansion with teams based in China to manage supply chain efficiency and product quality (BetaKit, June 2021)", "Launched a membership program in 2023/2024 to provide deeper discounts, indicating a shift toward customer retention and subscription-based retail (Browze.com)"]

hook: Expanded their 'Bungii for Business' platform in 2024 to integrate directly with enterprise POS systems, targeting large-scale retail delivery partnerships (Bungii Press, 2024).
overview: Bungii provides technology-enabled, last-mile delivery services for large items, partnering with major retailers like Floor & Decor and Costco to offer same-day, on-demand logistics using a crowdsourced driver network.
company_bullets: ["Operates as a gig-economy platform connecting consumers and businesses with local pickup truck owners, removing the need for internal fleet maintenance (Company Website)", "Focused on 'Big & Bulky' last-mile logistics, serving over 45 markets across the United States (LinkedIn, Jan 2026)", "Revenue model is built on a technology layer for retail logistics rather than physical asset ownership, meaning they typically lack traditional gated distribution centers (Crunchbase)"]

hook: Expanded cross-border operations in Jan 2026 by adding 450,000 sq ft of warehousing and cross-docking space in El Paso to support a 35% growth in Chihuahua exports (Transport Topics, Jan 2026).
overview: C.H. Robinson is a global third-party logistics (3PL) giant providing freight transportation, brokerage, and supply chain management services via a primarily non-asset-based model.
company_bullets: ["Operates as a non-asset-based provider, managing freight through a network of 450,000 contract carriers rather than owning a private fleet (C.H. hook: Recently expanded its logistics footprint through the acquisition of ITG Transportation Services (June 2024), strengthening its intermodal and drayage capabilities.

hook: Cresa recently expanded its industrial presence by acquiring Dallas-based firm esrp, significantly increasing its logistics advisory capabilities in the Texas market (May 2022).
overview: Cresa is the world's largest commercial real estate advisory firm that exclusively represents occupiers, providing strategic services including site selection and facility management for industrial and logistics users.
company_bullets: ["Specializes in 'Occupier Strategy and Solutions' for industrial clients, managing site selection for large-scale distribution centers globally (Cresa Website)", "Acts as a key decision-influencer for security and infrastructure spend at client-operated facilities through its Project Management and Facility Management service lines (Cresa Services Overview)", "Managed over 57 million square feet of industrial space transactions in a single year, indicating massive influence over gate and yard layouts for third-party tenants (Cresa Industrial Report)"]

hook: Announced a Series A funding round led by Mosaic General Partnership and Shopify Ventures to accelerate its AI-powered B2B commerce and EDI network (March 2025).
overview: Crstl is an AI-native B2B commerce network and EDI platform that automates order fulfillment and compliance for brands, retailers, and logistics providers.
company_bullets: ["Provides an AI-driven EDI platform that integrates with WMS, ERP, and 3PL systems to automate wholesale and dropship order fulfillment (company website)", "Closed a Series A funding round of over $10 million in March 2025 to expand its AI-native solutions for brands and logistics providers (PR Newswire, March 2025)", "Enables retailers and brands to manage mission-critical documents like EDI 940 (Warehouse Shipping Order) and EDI 945 (Warehouse Shipping Advice) without manual intervention (company website)"]

hook: Secured $42M in Series B funding led by Bessemer Venture Partners to expand its logistics infrastructure and 'elastic fleet' capabilities (June 2023).
overview: Curri is a logistics technology company providing a nationwide, on-demand elastic fleet for the construction and industrial supply industries, specializing in last-mile delivery of heavy and oversized materials.
company_bullets: ["Operates as an asset-light 3PL platform connecting industrial suppliers like Ferguson and Sherwin-Williams with a network of vetted gig-economy drivers (Construction Digital, June 2023).", "Provides a virtual fleet including everything from sedans and pickup trucks to flatbeds and semi-trailers, handling over $1B in supplies annually (Company Website, 2025).", "Recent expansion focuses on 'Fleet Rightsizing' software, helping distributors reduce their owned fleet costs by augmenting with Curri's on-demand network (Company Blog, April 2025)."]

hook: DC Velocity is currently focusing its 2026 editorial coverage on 'Smart Warehousing' and automation, providing a prime platform for advertising gate security solutions to their audience of 50,000+ logistics executives.
overview: DC Velocity is a leading B2B media brand and multi-channel content provider focused on the logistics and supply chain industry, specifically targeting decision-makers in distribution and warehousing.
company_bullets: ["Owned by Agile Business Media, the brand serves as a primary information source for DC managers and supply chain VPs (DC Velocity Media Kit 2026)", "The publication maintains a qualified circulation of over 50,000 logistics professionals across print and digital platforms (LinkedIn Business Profile)", "Hosts the 'Logistics Matters' podcast, which frequently features interviews with executives from top-tier 3PLs and retailers regarding facility security (DC Velocity Website, Jan 2026)"]

hook: Unveiled a $35M expansion of their Hobart, Indiana manufacturing facility in October 2025, doubling production capacity to meet North American automation demand.
overview: Daifuku is a global leader in material handling and factory automation, providing advanced storage, transport, and sorting systems for industries including e-commerce, automotive, and semiconductors.
company_bullets: ["Specializes in automated storage and retrieval systems (AS/RS) and intralogistics solutions for third-party distribution centers (daifuku.com)", "Completed a 310,000 sq ft expansion of its Hobart manufacturing plant in October 2025, reaching a total site area of 630,000 sq ft (house.gov, Oct 2025)", "Launched the 'Kyoto Lab' R&D hub in November 2025 to advance AI and robotic logistics technologies (globaldata.com, Nov 2025)"]

hook: Announced that Supergasbras, a major LPG distributor, modernized its fleet operations using Descartes' cloud-based routing and management solutions (Jan 2026)
overview: Descartes is a leading provider of cloud-based logistics and supply chain management software, operating the Global Logistics Network (GLN) to connect thousands of businesses for data exchange and operational optimization.
company_bullets: ["Operates the Global Logistics Network (GLN), connecting over 26,000 customers and 200,000 parties across 160 countries (dcfmodeling.com, Q3 2025)", "Acquired Finale Inventory in August 2025 to expand its cloud-based inventory management and e-commerce fulfillment capabilities (GlobalData, Aug 2025)", "Reported record Q3 FY2026 services revenue of $173.7 million, representing 93% of total revenue and highlighting a pure-play software model (Motley Fool Canada, Jan 2026)"]

hook: Assigned to install a $4.22M conveyor system at Amazon's 12th Jacksonville facility, showcasing their high-value project integration role (April 2025).
overview: Designed Conveyor Systems (DCS) is a material handling systems integrator that provides custom warehouse automation, conveyor design, and supply chain consulting for e-commerce and retail distribution.
company_bullets: ["Headquartered in Franklin, TN, the company has completed more than 1,500 projects including greenfield facility builds and retrofits (company website)", "Acquired supply chain consulting firm Waller Consulting in January 2024 to enhance end-to-end automation and facility design capabilities (Press Release, Jan 2024)", "Employs approximately 288 people across North America and Europe as of December 2025, specializing in complex parcel handling and e-commerce fulfillment (LeadIQ, Dec 2025)"]

hook: Closed a $95M funding round at a $1.65B valuation and unveiled the 'Mech' mobile manipulation robot for automated truck loading (March 2025).
overview: Dexterity, Inc. is a leading robotics company that develops 'Physical AI' to equip industrial robots with human-like dexterity for complex warehouse tasks like truck loading and palletizing.
company_bullets: ["Partnered with FedEx to deploy AI-powered robots for autonomous truck loading, specifically solving the '3D Tetris' challenge of stacking randomized boxes (The Robot Report, April 2024)", "Formed a strategic joint venture with Sumitomo Corporation to deploy 1,500 robotic systems across Japanese logistics sites by 2026 (Business Wire, July 2024)", "Launched 'Mech,' an industrial superhumanoid robot featuring dual arms with a 130-pound lifting capacity designed to operate in extreme warehouse temperatures from 32\u00b0F to 122\u00b0F (Robotics 24/7, March 2025)"]

hook: Announced the release of advanced Warehouse Loading and Site Assessment enhancements to its platform to streamline last-mile handoffs (DispatchTrack News, Jan 2026)
overview: DispatchTrack is a SaaS provider specializing in AI-powered last-mile delivery and logistics management software for industries such as retail, furniture, and food distribution.
company_bullets: ["Provides a cloud-based delivery management platform used by 2,500+ companies globally to optimize 1 million deliveries daily (DispatchTrack 'About Us' page)", "Launched 'Driver AI' in 2025, an industry-first voice assistant designed to help delivery drivers navigate site-specific access and parking constraints (DispatchTrack News)", "Primary customers include major distributors like Ferguson Enterprises, which utilizes the platform across 1,100 sales locations and 4,000+ delivery assets (DispatchTrack Case Study)"]

hook: Acquired Massiano Logistics in June 2025 to expand their final-mile network and warehousing footprint in Florida, Georgia, North Carolina, and New Jersey.
overview: Diverse Logistics & Distribution is a nationwide third-party logistics (3PL) provider specializing in final-mile delivery, installation, and warehousing of big-and-bulky goods such as appliances and furniture.
company_bullets: ["Operates a non-asset logistics model utilizing over 500 local delivery teams for final-mile and white-glove services (diverselogistics.com)", "Acquired Massiano Logistics in June 2025, adding specialized furniture delivery expertise and additional facilities in the Southeast and Northeast (PR Newswire, June 2025)", "Specializes in the high-value 'big and bulky' sector, including appliances, electronics, and fitness equipment for major brands like Electrolux (diverselogistics.com)"]

hook: Recognized by FedEx for exceptional performance in its Surface Network Purchased Transportation program (Sept 2025).
overview: Don Hummer Trucking is a family-owned asset-based carrier headquartered in Iowa, providing nationwide truckload, dry van, and temperature-controlled freight services.
company_bullets: ["Operates a fleet of 315 power units and 765 trailers with primary cargo including general freight, refrigerated foods, and building materials (CarrierSource, Jan 2026)", "Named 2024 Truckload Carrier of the Year by HNI Corporation and Carrier of the Year by PepsiCo's WHD Central Division (company website, May 2025)", "Maintains a significant Midwest presence with a 98%+ on-time delivery rate across key markets (company news, May 2025)"]

hook: Launched the Yard AI Alliance in September 2024 to integrate advanced AI vision into existing Yard Management Systems (YMS), partnering with major providers like C3 Solutions and FourKites.
overview: EAIGLE is a technology provider specializing in AI and computer vision solutions designed to automate and optimize yard management, security, and logistics operations for distribution centers and warehouses.
company_bullets: ["Offers AVAC\u2122 (Automated Vehicle Access Control) which uses AI vision to reduce gate processing times from minutes to seconds by identifying truck/trailer numbers and license plates (eaigle.com)", "Partnered with FourKites in August 2024 to integrate AI and computer vision into their 'Dynamic Yard' and 'Appointment Manager' solutions for full gate automation (DC Velocity, Aug 2024)", "Provides YardSight\u2122 technology to monitor loading docks and truck parking spots in real-time, eliminating manual yard audits (eaigle.com)"]

hook: EasyPost recently expanded its carbon offset program and enhanced its 'SmartRate' API to help shippers optimize costs amidst rising 2024 carrier surcharges (Company Blog, Jan 2024).
overview: EasyPost is a multi-carrier shipping API that provides businesses with integration tools for label generation, tracking, and address verification across over 100 global carriers.
company_bullets: ["EasyPost operates as a pure-play software-as-a-service (SaaS) provider and does not own or operate physical distribution centers or warehouses (EasyPost Help Center/FAQ).", "The company focuses on digital logistics infrastructure, processing billions of shipments via API integrations rather than physical handling (Forbes, 2023).", "Strategic partnerships are their primary growth lever, such as the recent integration with the specialized carrier 'Better Trucks' to expand regional delivery options (Business Wire, Nov 2023)."]

hook: Featured a segment on the deployment of Greece's first 'Delivery Robots' in Chios as part of a maritime and logistics research initiative (ERT Echo, Jan 2026)
overview: Echo (ertecho.gr) is the digital audio and radio platform of ERT (Hellenic Broadcasting Corporation), Greece's state-owned public broadcaster, offering live streaming and on-demand content.
company_bullets: ["The ertecho.gr domain serves as the primary digital hub for all 27+ Greek national and regional public radio stations (ertecho.gr)", "While not a logistics company, the platform frequently reports on Greece's infrastructure, including the 500 million euro logistics investment schedule for 2024 (ered.gr, Feb 2024)", "The platform is managed by ERT A.E., which operates extensive broadcasting infrastructure and regional studios across Greece, though not commercial distribution centers (ertecho.gr)"]

hook: Recently announced a definitive $1.8 billion SPAC merger with Legato Merger Corp. III to go public on the NYSE in early 2026, intended to accelerate driverless freight deployments (Nov 2025).
overview: Einride is a Swedish freight technology company that provides end-to-end electric and autonomous freight mobility through its proprietary AI platform, Saga, and its fleet of cabless 'Pods' and heavy-duty electric trucks.
company_bullets: ["Operates a dual business model consisting of Freight-Capacity-as-a-Service (FCaaS) and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) for electric/autonomous logistics (Forbes, Nov 2025)", "Partnered with Mars to deploy 300 electric heavy-duty trucks across Europe by 2030, with an autonomous pilot scheduled for 2025 (Mars.com, Jan 2024)", "Launched North America's largest electric heavy-duty charging site in Lynwood, CA, capable of charging up to 200 vehicles daily near the Ports of LA and Long Beach (ChargedEVs, Mar 2024)"]

hook: Launched in March 2023 in partnership with NT Logistics, Freight Think specializes in 'surgical' transportation audits and network design to drive profitability for mid-to-large shippers.
overview: Freight Think is a transportation advisory and logistics consulting group that helps shippers optimize freight expenditures, carrier contracts, and supply chain networks.
company_bullets: ["Co-founded by supply chain veterans Reid Klosowsky and Bill Maroney in partnership with NT Logistics (thetrucker.com, March 2023)", "Provides advisory services including carrier contract review, freight bill auditing, and packaging/network design (freightthink.com)", "Focuses on bridging the gap between product and logistics teams to optimize total company profitability (dallasinnovates.com, March 2023)"]

hook: Partnered with NT Logistics to launch a new data-driven advisory approach that optimizes complex supply chains in under two weeks (March 2023).
overview: Freight Think LLC is a specialized transportation advisory and consulting group that focuses on optimizing supply chain strategy, reducing freight expenditures, and improving logistics efficiency for shippers.
company_bullets: ["Operates as a non-asset-based consultancy providing carrier contract review, network design, and freight auditing (freightthink.com)", "Co-founded by supply chain veterans Reid Klosowsky and Bill Maroney, who have managed billions in annual spend for retail and distribution sectors (PR Newswire, Mar 2023)", "Leverages NT Logistics' proprietary business intelligence platform to provide lane-level data analytics for shippers (thetrucker.com, Mar 2023)"]

hook: Expanded their 'FreightVana x' neutral trailer pool initiative in 2024 to address nationwide trailer capacity imbalances for shippers and carriers (FreightWaves, 2024).
overview: FreightVana is a digital freight broker and logistics technology provider that offers managed transportation services, power-only solutions, and a neutral trailer pool through its 'FreightVana x' division.
company_bullets: ["Operates as a digital freight brokerage focusing on high-tech matching of shippers with carrier capacity (Company Website)", "Launched 'FreightVana x', a large-scale neutral trailer pool designed to provide power-only carriers with access to drop-and-hook freight (FreightWaves, June 2022)", "The company focuses on a 'human-centric' digital model, leveraging a small workforce of ~80 employees to manage high-volume logistics technology (LinkedIn / Crunchbase)"]

hook: Renewed their Transportation Intermediaries Association (TIA) membership for 2025, highlighting their continued focus on verified, high-compliance carrier networks for expedited and pharmaceutical freight (company website, Jan 2025).

hook: Expanded the commercial team with two key additions in February 2025 to scale member support and procurement services (Gemini News, Feb 2025).
overview: Gemini Shippers Association is a leading non-profit shippers association that provides ocean freight procurement, logistics consulting, and supply chain technology solutions for its member companies.

hook: Georgia Tech's Supply Chain and Logistics Institute (SCL) recently held the 2025 Fall Senior Design Competition (Dec 18, 2025), highlighting their role as a hub for next-generation logistics technology testing.
overview: The Georgia Institute of Technology (Georgia Tech) is a public research university and institute of technology in Atlanta, Georgia, renowned for its global leadership in supply chain and logistics research.
company_bullets: ["Home to the Georgia Tech Supply Chain and Logistics Institute (SCL), which offers professional education in 'Safe, Healthy & Secure Working Environments' for warehouse operations (gatech.edu)", "The Institute's Fleet Management department manages a diverse range of university vehicles, including heavy-duty trucks for campus infrastructure, in compliance with Georgia DOAS standards (gatech.edu)", "Acts as a major innovation hub for logistics companies and startups through its Logistics Innovation Centers and the SIReN Lab, focusing on AI and immersive technologies in supply chains (gatech.edu)"]

hook: GoodShip recently closed a $5M Series A funding round led by Liberty City Ventures to expand its procurement automation and AI-driven carrier scorecarding capabilities (FreightWaves, Feb 2024).
overview: GoodShip is a cloud-based logistics platform that provides shippers and carriers with tools for freight procurement, contract management, and real-time performance analytics.
company_bullets: ["Operates as a pure-play SaaS platform for collaborative freight procurement and does not own or operate physical warehouses or trucks (GoodShip Website)", "The company serves enterprise shippers like Wilbur-Ellis and many large brokers to digitize manual freight bidding processes (TechCrunch, Feb 2024)", "Recently integrated with major TMS providers like McLeod and MercuryGate to centralize carrier performance data (GoodShip Product Update, 2024)"]

hook: The Hall of Fame Village recently completed Phase II of its $600M expansion, including the opening of the Fan Engagement Zone and Gameday Bay waterpark in late 2024 (Company Annual Report, 2024).
overview: The Pro Football Hall of Fame is a non-profit organization dedicated to honoring the history of professional football through its museum, events, and the multi-use Hall of Fame Village development.
company_bullets: ["The organization operates primarily as a 100,000-square-foot museum and event venue in Canton, Ohio, rather than a logistics-heavy enterprise (ProFootballHOF.com)", "Major physical operations are concentrated within the 200-acre Hall of Fame Village, which manages high-volume visitor parking and security for large-scale events (HOF Village Investor Relations, Jan 2025)", "Maintains a retail fulfillment operation for its online store, though warehousing is conducted on-site or through third-party merchandising partners rather than a dedicated DC network (HOF Store Shipping Policy)"]

hook: Expanded Illinois distribution by transitioning to the Anheuser-Busch network to increase retail reach (October 2025).
overview: Happy Dad LLC is a rapidly growing beverage company that produces and markets hard seltzers, teas, and lemonades, leveraging a high-impact influencer-led model.
company_bullets: ["Operates as an asset-light beverage brand, outsourcing production and utilizing third-party networks like Anheuser-Busch and ColdHaus for fulfillment (happydad.com, Oct 2025)", "Secured a substantial new credit facility from Assembled Brands in May 2024 to scale inventory and pursue strategic partnerships (abfjournal.com, May 2024)", "Achieved a 98% fill rate in Canada through a logistics partnership with ColdHaus Direct for grocery and convenience store delivery (happydad.com, Nov 2025)"]

hook: Raised $44M in Series B funding led by Base10 Partners to expand its 'digital workforce' for the real economy, specifically targeting logistics communication (Sept 2025).
overview: HappyRobot is an AI-native operating system and orchestration platform that automates supply chain communications through specialized AI 'workers' that handle freight negotiations, scheduling, and carrier sales.
company_bullets: ["Provides an AI operating system that automates track-and-trace, freight rate negotiation, and appointment scheduling for over 70 enterprise customers including DHL and Ryder (Tech Funding News, Sept 2025)", "Deeply integrated with transportation management systems (TMS) to handle millions of voice minutes and hundreds of thousands of emails annually (DHL Group Press Release, Nov 2025)", "Strategic focus on 'the real economy' and industrial-scale operations, utilizing a vertically integrated platform that combines voice synthesis, OCR, and web browsing (Microsoft for Startups Blog, Oct 2025)"]

hook: Honeywell announced in July 2025 that it is evaluating strategic alternatives, including a potential spin-off, for its Warehouse and Workflow Solutions (WWS) division, which operates the Intelligrated brand.

company_bullets: ["Partnered with TruckerCloud to integrate real-time telematics and video data for its commercial auto and transportation lines (PR Newswire, Sept 2025)", "Operates as a high-volume commercial auto MGA writing roughly $300M in annual premiums across focus sectors like oil/gas, construction, and local delivery (Insurance Insider US, June 2024)", "Maintains primary operational hubs in Dallas, Texas and Miramar, Florida to handle underwriting and 24/7 claims services (company website)"]

hook: Named the #3 company on the 2026 FreightWaves FreightTech 25 list and recently launched pioneering AI voice scheduling for modern logistics (Jan 2026).
overview: Qued is an AI-driven smart workflow platform that automates load appointment scheduling for freight brokers, 3PLs, and carriers by integrating directly with Transportation Management Systems (TMS).
company_bullets: ["Automates 95% of load appointments autonomously by using AI to synchronize dock schedules with existing TMS data (FreightWaves, Aug 2025)", "Strategic partner of Opendock, the largest dock scheduling platform serving over 50 Fortune 500 companies (Loadsmart Blog, Jun 2024)", "Reduced appointment scheduling time for 3PL partner Axle Logistics from over an hour to under five minutes per load (Company Press Release, Feb 2025)"]

hook: Recognized by SpiceJet as a preferred partner for air cargo operations and has expanded its footprint to 24 operational airport locations in India (QuickBox India, Jan 2026).

hook: Released their '2024 Parcel Logistics Strategy Guide' in late 2023, focusing on AI-driven contract negotiation for enterprise shippers.

hook: Roadie announced the expansion of 'Roadie Green' in October 2024, a sustainable delivery initiative that utilizes eco-friendly local delivery partner hubs rather than traditional company-owned distribution centers.
overview: Roadie, a UPS company, is a crowdsourced delivery platform that provides same-day and local delivery services using a network of independent drivers rather than a traditional hub-and-spoke logistics model.
company_bullets: ["Operates as a wholly owned subsidiary of UPS but maintains a distinct crowdsourced operational model (UPS Pressroom, Sept 2021)", "Launched 'RoadieXD' in 2023, which utilizes temporary cross-docking facilities to enable rapid sorting and delivery of big-and-bulky items (Roadie Official Site, 2023)", "The platform leverages over 200,000 independent drivers to reach 97% of U.S. households without maintaining a central private fleet (Forbes, June 2024)"]

hook: The NWSA recently broke ground on the $140 million Terminal 5 expansion project to enhance gate efficiency and cargo handling capacity (NWSA Press Release, October 2025).
overview: The Northwest Seaport Alliance (NWSA) is a marine cargo operating partnership between the Port of Seattle and the Port of Tacoma, managing one of the largest container gateways in North America.
company_bullets: ["Managed over 3 million TEUs in 2024, acting as a critical landlord for major international shipping lines (NWSA 2024 Annual Report)", "Invested $12 million in a new Heavy Haul Corridor and truck staging infrastructure to alleviate congestion near the Port of Tacoma (NWSA Projects Update, August 2025)", "The NWSA operates as a landlord port, meaning security and gate operations at individual terminals are typically managed by private Stevedoring companies like SSA Marine or TTI (NWSA Governance Overview)"]

hook: Voila recently expanded its AI-powered 'Reddit' presence (June 2025) to scale its print-on-demand platform, which currently serves over 40,000 creators.
overview: Visual Chameleon, Inc. (operating as Voila) is an AI-powered social commerce and print-on-demand platform that connects creators with 20,000+ brands and manages custom merchandise production.

hook: Showcased 'Alloy Kore,' a foundational vehicle software platform co-developed with QNX, at CES 2026 to enhance software-defined vehicle capabilities (Vector News, Jan 2026).
